subject: Delete outdated entities by the consistency
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-02 11:33:01.000000000', 'message': 'Delete outdated entities by the consistency

As part of Rocky fast-failover support,
vitrage-graph is now reloaded from the
database. This causes an issue with
datasources using caches, that can become
outdated in two cases

- After vitrage-graph restart. This is
handled by the consistency service.

- If more than one vitrage-collector is used.

The solution/workaround for Rocky is to let
the consistency enforcer delete outdated
entities for datasources that specifically
request it.

For Stein, we should move this handling to
the processor (so the entities will be
deleted immediately) and delete all the
caches

Change-Id: I953137dc870f48ed42acba93789bb947809c41cc

commit_message:
Delete outdated entities by the consistency

As part of Rocky fast-failover support,
vitrage-graph is now reloaded from the
database. This causes an issue with
datasources using caches, that can become
outdated in two cases

- After vitrage-graph restart. This is
handled by the consistency service.

- If more than one vitrage-collector is used.

The solution/workaround for Rocky is to let
the consistency enforcer delete outdated
entities for datasources that specifically
request it.

For Stein, we should move this handling to
the processor (so the entities will be
deleted immediately) and delete all the
caches

Change-Id: I953137dc870f48ed42acba93789bb947809c41cc

commit_message:
Namespace svc isolation tempest coverage

It extends the namespace tests to also ensure proper services isolation
between namespaces.

It creates pods and services in different namespaces and checks that
traffic is blocked between them, unless it is the default namespace,
which can reach all the services regardless of the namespaces.

Depends-On: I7b78e12cdf2bce5d0780e582814ef51ef0c459a7
Change-Id: I460eb37415fa6d864c68e29ee79abdc8d1760c61
Implements: blueprint openshift-project-isolation-support

[{'created': '2018-07-27 10:14:25.000000000', 'message': "Fix overwriting downloaded config files

When we wrote downloaded config files over previously existing ones,
we sometimes got garbled files with remainders of the previous state,
e.g.:

step_4:
  keystone_refresh:
    action: exec
    command:
    - keystone
    - pkill
    - --signal
    - USR1
    - httpd
    start_order: 1
    user: root
start_order: 1
    user: root

This was because we opened the file for writing but didn't truncate
its size, so this commit adds O_TRUNC to the flags for opening
files. It's very similar to bug 1434187 which we had a long time ago.

Change-Id: Ib1d3c68ec3c4048ffc7277daf84834288ea50e48
Closes-Bug: #1783866

commit_message:
Fix overwriting downloaded config files

When we wrote downloaded config files over previously existing ones,
we sometimes got garbled files with remainders of the previous state,
e.g.:

step_4:
  keystone_refresh:
    action: exec
    command:
    - keystone
    - pkill
    - --signal
    - USR1
    - httpd
    start_order: 1
    user: root
start_order: 1
    user: root

This was because we opened the file for writing but didn't truncate
its size, so this commit adds O_TRUNC to the flags for opening
files. It's very similar to bug 1434187 which we had a long time ago.

Revert "Fix deploy health checks"
Depends-On: Ia2c12d7455564b6297c5f0934812b10fabbdc914

Change-Id: Ib1d3c68ec3c4048ffc7277daf84834288ea50e48
Closes-Bug: #1783866

[{'created': '2018-08-07 10:16:07.000000000', 'message': 'Fix all py37 incompatible things

* Sort table by "Platform" at `rally env check` command. It is needed
  to make the result of unittests equal at python 2 and python 3 envs.
  Also, the resulting table become more readable and user-friendly.
* Fix usage of StopIteration in generators.
* Deprecate 'async' argument of api method task.abort

Change-Id: I4dbf674817f8d40bb0708dd0a32caeb0dbda8c5e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix all py37 incompatible things

* Sort table by "Platform" at `rally env check` command. It is needed
  to make the result of unittests equal at python 2 and python 3 envs.
  Also, the resulting table become more readable and user-friendly.
* Fix usage of StopIteration in generators.
* Deprecate 'async' argument of api method task.abort

Change-Id: I4dbf674817f8d40bb0708dd0a32caeb0dbda8c5e

commit_message:
Ensure that we support py34,py36,py37 envs

This patch adds non-voting CI jobs for py34,py36,py37 envs. They will be
turned to the voting as soon as they become green.

Also, since configuration of zuul become bigger, it is moved to the
separate directory.

Change-Id: I2f9d526e769f37792db23242ef51e6bb703b2524

LGTM, I would like to see the release note revised though.'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2018-07-31 05:28:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Thanks for the patch, it looks good, except I want to figure out why we don't clean up the deleting state in this patch.

Recently I hit this issue, so it makes a lot sense to me, in my environment a node is stuck at deleting state and we can only restore the state by updating database manually.

If it's because we have not 'fail' event from DELETING, I think we still can use the 'error' event to drive DELETING to ERROR state. Technically I think there is no reason we don't do it."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-07-31 12:37:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Thanks for the patch, it looks good, except I want to figure out
 > why we don't clean up the deleting state in this patch.
 > 
 > Recently I hit this issue, so it makes a lot sense to me, in my
 > environment a node is stuck at deleting state and we can only
 > restore the state by updating database manually.
 > 
 > If it's because we have not 'fail' event from DELETING, I think we
 > still can use the 'error' event to drive DELETING to ERROR state.
 > Technically I think there is no reason we don't do it.

So it looks like we have no state mapped for deleting to be able to changed to another state I'm fine if we add a transition and another state, but it is a little late to do so in the cycle. I think we should land this, and then try to figure out why delete hung because delete should be a very rapid process... and how do we recover from that upon start-up."}, {'account_id': 18320, 'date': '2018-07-31 13:07:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-07-31 13:24:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2018-07-31 14:59:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Node gets stuck in ING state when conductor goes down

If a node is in ING state such as INSPECTING, RESCUING, and
the conductor goes down, when the conductor backs, the node
gets stuck with that ING state.

The cases for (DEPLOYING, CLEANING) are already processed
as expected, but (INSPECTING, RESCUING, UNRESCUING, VERIFYING,
ADOPTING). DELETING cannot be transitioned to 'fail' state.

Change-Id: Ie6886ea78fac8bae81675dabf467939deb1c4460
Story: #2003147
Task: #23282

commit_message:
Release 0.17.2 of openstacksdk

Bugfix release dealing with exception handling inside of the
TaskManager. The issue was encountered in production for nodepool and is
a fix to remediate that issue.

Change-Id: I5f4574fd7d5d3bd70769e93e94c4a061a54f9b14

commit_message:
Improve Tempest documentation

Use ..note syntax for notes and use :command: refference for
discover-tempest-config command in order to obtain a proper
formating.

Make a few refferences to python-tempestconf's documentation.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580981/
Change-Id: I9fd6674d53b628e686821bba526095f0493cee34
Story: 2002703
Task: 22544

commit_message:
Notes warning for mixing multiple command line clients.

This note is a warning against using project native command line clients
and unified command line client together within a specific operator
workflow.

Change-Id: Ifcadef8b5ffa6454a9d92b6cb390dc3ccd9c87f5
Closes-Bug: 1783180

commit_message:
Add notes on the undercloud's autogenerated TLS setup

This adds two things:

* TLS is now the default as of Rocky.

* How to trust the default CA certificate from the undercloud in case
  you need to use it.

* How to trust the undercloud's CA certificate on your overcloud
  deployment.

Change-Id: Ia83e8f73d9dca0c8e4296eba6177173de8646d04
Depends-On: Id329081c06343373309d6880d464ba99aba0c7be

commit_message:
Add namespace support for workbooks

This patch brings namespace support to workbooks.
Namespace of the workbook is inherited by workflows.

Implements: blueprint mistral-namespace-for-actions-workbooks
Change-Id: I2c66b3961915f0f35a9c468eb6dd0c0c70995234

commit_message:
add soft validation of extra-atcs

We do not want to fail the linters job because existing valid
memberships can be closed or deleted at any time, so we just report
the errors to stdout.

Change-Id: I70bcab87c839760c43fc667dd526bd6992a46e53
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 13:37:45.000000000', 'message': "RemoteFS: don't fail in do_mount if already mounted

This fixes a problem where two different callers are
mounting a share at the same time:
    A: check if share is mounted
    B: check if share is mounted
    A: mount share
    B: mount share  (fails because it is already mounted)

Closes-Bug: 1780813
Change-Id: I6eca9c9e9eceb7aef357b0ed77bf157ac0010bfe
(cherry picked from commit 2f32c98a650910fd837fd592daa6c5e0e5458fcd)
"}]
commit_message:
RemoteFS: don't fail in do_mount if already mounted

This fixes a problem where two different callers are
mounting a share at the same time:
    A: check if share is mounted
    B: check if share is mounted
    A: mount share
    B: mount share  (fails because it is already mounted)

Closes-Bug: 1780813
Change-Id: I6eca9c9e9eceb7aef357b0ed77bf157ac0010bfe
(cherry picked from commit 2f32c98a650910fd837fd592daa6c5e0e5458fcd)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-03 12:06:03.000000000', 'message': 'Target metadata requests at the correct cell.

Currently when processing a metadata request a request is sent to
get the cell mapping for the instance in question. This resulting
mapping is then used to construct a RequestContext to retrieve
the metadata itself. However, when
ConductorAPI.object_class_action_versions is called with the
cell aware context the location of the mq for the target cell is
ignored and instead the metadata request is sent back to the
super-conductor.

This change checks the context for a message queue and if one is
present that is used rather than the default.

Change-Id: I25acba2a57bc183acb60284b89ddd7c851eae6ed
Closes-Bug: #1785235
'}]
commit_message:
Target metadata requests at the correct cell.

Currently when processing a metadata request a request is sent to
get the cell mapping for the instance in question. This resulting
mapping is then used to construct a RequestContext to retrieve
the metadata itself. However, when
ConductorAPI.object_class_action_versions is called with the
cell aware context the location of the mq for the target cell is
ignored and instead the metadata request is sent back to the
super-conductor.

This change checks the context for a message queue and if one is
present that is used rather than the default.

Change-Id: I25acba2a57bc183acb60284b89ddd7c851eae6ed
Closes-Bug: #1785235

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-19 23:26:37.000000000', 'message': "Fix message for unexpected external event

During live migration, we get vif plugged events
that we're not waiting for, and if InstanceEvents._events
is empty, pop_instance_event() will log a message about
shutting down, but the compute service isn't actually
shutting down. When it is, ComputeManager.cleanup_host()
calls cancel_all_events() which sets _events to None, so
we should only mention shutting down when _events is None.

Change-Id: Ie868273c4b9629f9b35645df5785304ebba5d64c
Closes-Bug: #1756994
"}]
commit_message:
Fix message for unexpected external event

During live migration, we get vif plugged events
that we're not waiting for, and if InstanceEvents._events
is empty, pop_instance_event() will log a message about
shutting down, but the compute service isn't actually
shutting down. When it is, ComputeManager.cleanup_host()
calls cancel_all_events() which sets _events to None, so
we should only mention shutting down when _events is None.

Change-Id: Ie868273c4b9629f9b35645df5785304ebba5d64c
Closes-Bug: #1756994

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-20 15:25:26.000000000', 'message': 'migration: handle the new json inventory format and silence greps

Something recently changed how the inventory json file is generated
and now the hosts are available straight away under the
Controller / Compute roles, but we still keep support for the old
form.

We add an extra lookup to get the ip address and include it as
ansible_host.

In this same commit we silence the greps which verify proper
configuration of the deployment scripts to avoid grep findings
being output to the console.

Change-Id: I676a8dfbbac350943d4586bb09fd1e97086091fc

commit_message:
migration: handle the new json inventory format and silence greps

Something recently changed how the inventory json file is generated
and now the hosts are available straight away under the
Controller / Compute roles, but we still keep support for the old
form.

We add an extra lookup to get the ip address and include it as
ansible_host.

In this same commit we silence the greps which verify proper
configuration of the deployment scripts to avoid grep findings
being output to the console.

Change-Id: I676a8dfbbac350943d4586bb09fd1e97086091fc

(2 comments)

I'm not sure if this has any impact on the CachingScheduler or not. The CachingScheduler maintains a local cache of HostStates which it rebuilds on a periodic (by default every minute). Before this change, the cache in the caching scheduler driver would be updated based on the global cached value in the host manager, and this change removes the latter cache, so the caching scheduler just gets a fresh (uncached) view every minute, which is probably OK - there might be a slight reduction in performance but the overall benefit of using the caching scheduler should still be there since we don't pull all hosts (compute nodes) for every request - just every 60 seconds."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-01-30 19:10:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

 > change, the cache in the caching scheduler driver would be updated

 > change removes the latter cache, so the caching scheduler just gets

 > of using the caching scheduler should still be there since we don't
 > pull all hosts (compute nodes) for every request - just every 60
 > seconds.

Agreed there's a slight reduction in performance because we will build the host state view fresh each periodic interval. revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-13 22:27:26.000000000', 'message': 'Stop globally caching host states in scheduler HostManager

Currently, in the scheduler HostManager, we cache host states in
a map global to all requests. This used to be okay because we were
always querying the entire compute node list for every request to
pass on to filtering. So we cached the host states globally and
updated them per request and removed "dead nodes" from the cache
(compute nodes still in the cache that were not returned from
ComputeNodeList.get_all).

As of Ocata, we started filtering our ComputeNodeList query based on
an answer from placement about which resource providers could satisfy
the request, instead of querying the entire compute node list every
time. This is much more efficient (don't consider compute nodes that
can't possibly fulfill the request) BUT it doesn't play well with the
global host state cache. We started seeing "Removing dead compute node"
messages in the logs, signaling removal of compute nodes from the
global cache when compute nodes were actually available.

If request A comes in and all compute nodes can satisy its request,
then request B arrives concurrently and no compute nodes can satisfy
its request, the request B request will remove all the compute nodes
from the global host state cache and then request A will get "no valid
hosts" at the filtering stage because get_host_states_by_uuids returns
a generator that hands out hosts from the global host state cache.

This removes the global host state cache from the scheduler HostManager
and instead generates a fresh host state map per request and uses that
to return hosts from the generator. Because we're filtering the
ComputeNodeList based on a placement query per request, each request
can have a completely different set of compute nodes that can fulfill
it, so we're not gaining much by caching host states anyway.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dansmith@redhat.com>

Closes-Bug: #1742827

Change-Id: I40c17ed88f50ecbdedc4daf368fff10e90e7be11

commit_message:
Stop globally caching host states in scheduler HostManager

Currently, in the scheduler HostManager, we cache host states in
a map global to all requests. This used to be okay because we were
always querying the entire compute node list for every request to
pass on to filtering. So we cached the host states globally and
updated them per request and removed "dead nodes" from the cache
(compute nodes still in the cache that were not returned from
ComputeNodeList.get_all).

As of Ocata, we started filtering our ComputeNodeList query based on
an answer from placement about which resource providers could satisfy
the request, instead of querying the entire compute node list every
time. This is much more efficient (don't consider compute nodes that
can't possibly fulfill the request) BUT it doesn't play well with the
global host state cache. We started seeing "Removing dead compute node"
messages in the logs, signaling removal of compute nodes from the
global cache when compute nodes were actually available.

If request A comes in and all compute nodes can satisfy its request,
then request B arrives concurrently and no compute nodes can satisfy
its request, the request B request will remove all the compute nodes
from the global host state cache and then request A will get "no valid
hosts" at the filtering stage because get_host_states_by_uuids returns
a generator that hands out hosts from the global host state cache.

This removes the global host state cache from the scheduler HostManager
and instead generates a fresh host state map per request and uses that
to return hosts from the generator. Because we're filtering the
ComputeNodeList based on a placement query per request, each request
can have a completely different set of compute nodes that can fulfill
it, so we're not gaining much by caching host states anyway.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dansmith@redhat.com>

Closes-Bug: #1742827
Related-Bug: #1739323

Change-Id: I40c17ed88f50ecbdedc4daf368fff10e90e7be11

commit_message:
Check for empty project entries

Check that no entries are added to zuul/projects.yaml that only contain
the project name but do not configure any jobs. These are redundant,
let's remove them.

commit_message:
Resize failed with nova resize auto confirm

I set the the params resize_confirm_window = 1 in
nova.conf, and then I resize the flavor of database
instance, but it except an error with "Cannot
'confirmResize' instance while it is in vm_state active"

For this problem, I think we need to consider to the nova
confirm resize by itself, so I add the confict exception
to fix this bug.

Closes-Bug: #1783247
Change-Id: I5e300e92cc3f9deb6e32b99ad7b11fde83578aae

commit_message:
Copy deployments.yaml to top level config-dir

The deployments.yaml tasks file is not specific to roles, it's the same
for all. Moving it to the top level config-dir directory will allow
parallelizing these tasks across all roles instead of doing the roles
one by one.

For the time being, it's also copied to the existing location under the
role specific dir for backwards compatibility so that this patch can
merge without initially breaking tripleo-heat-templates. See the related
tripleo-heat-templates patch:
I83a4deaa68d5788edb5ab13652bb30c762f337d8

Change-Id: I839ca7f95688a992e82c670e190c82659951e34d

Fix error thrown by logging in common/neutron.py

"TypeError: not all arguments converted during string formatting" error
is thrown due to an extra comma at the end of one of the string lines in
logging in common/neutron.py

commit_message:
Disable agent extension until it's fully stable

Change I43e8b0a7914e3626dd848b04fdfc54fb0351bae6 introduced
the API extension, but the alive flag is not perfectly stable
and makes tempest fail from time to time.

Terry wilson is working on a fix for this here [1], we will
request him to re-enable the extension within that patch.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585027/

Change-Id: Id75a6a97d38dce57c3c8386b3036a16950404469

commit_message:
Enable kubelet on multinode's gate subnode

This commit enables kubelet on subnode of multinode gate. With this we
should be able to test HA and pod-pod traffic that goes out of a node.

Change-Id: I26c499cd7d641ce7082e85b72f0ed5a31ba65185

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-14 10:59:19.000000000', 'message': "centos: clean altarch repositories situation a bit

CentOS team synced virt/kvm-common repository for alternate archs. This
allows us to drop special handling of DELOREAN repos from
common/config.py and aarch64 repos.

Instead we can just install 'centos-release-qemu-ev' package like it is
done on x86-64.

For now each 'yum' command complains about lack of
/centos/7/virt/kvm-common repo when kolla is run on altarch. There is
a change in RDO to solve that:

https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/13763/

Change-Id: Ie45a0b83fc4460d5dfce82efca061272db974ead
"}, {'created': '2018-06-11 07:30:29.000000000', 'message': "centos: clean altarch repositories situation a bit

CentOS team synced virt/kvm-common repository for alternate archs. We
can just install 'centos-release-qemu-ev' package like it is done on
x86-64.

Change-Id: Ie45a0b83fc4460d5dfce82efca061272db974ead
"}, {'created': '2018-07-10 10:12:35.000000000', 'message': "centos: clean altarch repositories situation a bit

CentOS team synced virt/kvm-common repository for alternate archs. We
can just install 'centos-release-qemu-ev' package like it is done on
x86-64.

Change-Id: Ie45a0b83fc4460d5dfce82efca061272db974ead
"}]
commit_message:
centos: clean altarch repositories situation a bit

CentOS team synced virt/kvm-common repository for alternate archs. We
can just install 'centos-release-qemu-ev' package like it is done on
x86-64.

Change-Id: Ie45a0b83fc4460d5dfce82efca061272db974ead

commit_message:
skipped_images None handling

skip the skipped_images loop when the combination is unknown,
or when the skiplist is empty.

Change-Id: Ia2dfbb1c80baeaa2eeb4720381e4da6c7b1c85af

messages:
[{'account_id': 26650, 'date': '2018-08-02 09:45:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28695, 'date': '2018-08-02 21:34:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

According to the "Stable branches" guide bug fixes:

Since this change will also be valuable for subsequent releases, I suggest rebasing onto "master" branch and then, after merge, backporting stable branches.'}, {'account_id': 28695, 'date': '2018-08-02 21:38:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-02 09:45:16.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the bug that resizing failed without volume-support

When I config the volume-support=False and device_path =
and then creating an instance successfully. But when I
resize the instance flavor, it faied with
"LocalStorageNotSpecified: Local storage not specified
 in flavor ID"

In the code, when volume-support is False, it will check
the device_path is None or not, but if config the
device_path=  , it be regarded as not None.

Closes-Bug: #1783244
Change-Id: I6b191da2b54999e5410146e2be8d93f0ca530473
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the bug that resizing failed without volume-support

When I config the volume-support=False and device_path =
and then creating an instance successfully. But when I
resize the instance flavor, it faied with
"LocalStorageNotSpecified: Local storage not specified
 in flavor ID"

In the code, when volume-support is False, it will check
the device_path is None or not, but if config the
device_path=  , it be regarded as not None.

Closes-Bug: #1783244
Change-Id: I6b191da2b54999e5410146e2be8d93f0ca530473

commit_message:
Move MAX_CHAIN_LEN constants to constants file

Two constants: MAX_CHAIN_LEN_{WRAP,NOWRAP} are now moved
to common.constants file and renamed to
MAX_IPTABLES_CHAIN_LEN_{WRAP,NOWRAP}.

It is done because at least one of them might be now used
outside iptables_manager module (in port_forwarding
extensions)

Change-Id: I9b7a24b0264631e74b3c05b73a22a6a9c2752e82

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-31 12:25:10.000000000', 'message': 'Unblock gate: Provide default rabbitmq password

The integrated build has no value for swift_rabbitmq_password
and yet the oslomsg vars reference it. Given that the integrated
gate is quite hard to merge anything into right now - set a
default value here temporarily until we can merge a fix there.

Change-Id: I8c13fe063cd5ec454196bc630cb6362f97c4f146
'}]
commit_message:
Unblock gate: Provide default rabbitmq password

The integrated build has no value for swift_rabbitmq_password
and yet the oslomsg vars reference it. Given that the integrated
gate is quite hard to merge anything into right now - set a
default value here temporarily until we can merge a fix there.

Change-Id: I8c13fe063cd5ec454196bc630cb6362f97c4f146

commit_message:
Stabilise Bifrost CI job

The Bifrost CI job seems quite unstable, often failing while attempting
to reach the public epel package repositories. We shouldn't need to
install any packages when deploying the container - they should all have
been installed in the image already.

This change avoids running the scripts/env-setup.sh script, which is run
when the container image is built.

It also removes sourcing of /opt/stack/ansible/hacking/env-setup, which
is now just a stub.

Change-Id: I1786e5337a397cb7b427d6b87c21eaee600af170

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-02 19:31:36.000000000', 'message': 'Grease test_try_deallocate_network_retry_direct

That's "grease" in the sense of "lubricate", or "make faster". Not in
the sense of "kill with an M3 submachine gun".

This test hits the compute manager's _try_deallocate_network helper in
such a way as to deliberately activate and exhaust its RetryDecorator,
which adds 12s to the test time. This patch mocks the sleep in that
retry loop, taking the test down to sub-second like it should be.

Change-Id: I60d11fc9a9e8569b1663c7319a5c25b921c5de1a
'}]
commit_message:
Grease test_try_deallocate_network_retry_direct

That's "grease" in the sense of "lubricate", or "make faster". Not in
the sense of "kill with an M3 submachine gun".

This test hits the compute manager's _try_deallocate_network helper in
such a way as to deliberately activate and exhaust its RetryDecorator,
which adds 12s to the test time. This patch mocks the sleep in that
retry loop, taking the test down to sub-second like it should be.

Change-Id: I60d11fc9a9e8569b1663c7319a5c25b921c5de1a

commit_message:
Grease some more tests hitting RetryDecorator

That's "grease" in the sense of "lubricate", or "make faster". Not in
the sense of "kill with an M3 submachine gun".

Similar optimizations to [1] in libvirt/test_guest (RetryDecorator in
detach_device_with_retry) and disk/mount/test_api (RetryDecorator in
Mount.map_dev).

[1] I60d11fc9a9e8569b1663c7319a5c25b921c5de1a

Change-Id: Ic7ad60ce89c93c0f03c040e244f8191c963c08f3

messages:
[{'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-08-04 09:54:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-08-04 14:10:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8871, 'date': '2018-08-04 16:12:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I noticed Zuul failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ocata: unrecognized error
- tempest-full-queens: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1732199
- tempest-multinode-full: unrecognized error

Some of the tests failed in a way that we did not understand. Please help us classify these issues so that they can be part of Elastic Recheck http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-08-04 17:18:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

LGTM. It looks there's one more usage of get_remote_client() here[0]. But the test is skipped because of the bug 1664793. So, I think we can leave it for now.

commit_message:
Pass "access_point" server to get_remote_client

Access point server is now passed to get_remote_client method
in test_security_groups_basic_ops module.
It will help to debug issues with connection to this access point
server in case if those tests will fail.

Change-Id: Ie6ab9019e3b1a2ca490a32a3c350f8deb5d3c357

This breaks downstream packaging because /bin/python is not well defined.  Would prefer /usr/bin/python if we could.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-04 08:27:01.000000000', 'message': "Revert shebang change for InstanceHA startup script

In Id915ded03ae5a471ffa2dca13e2da90021279f63 the shebang for
check-run-nova-compute has been changed to use /usr/bin/env, which
broke exec'ing the script:

  + exec /var/lib/nova/instanceha/check-run-nova-compute
  Running command: '/var/lib/nova/instanceha/check-run-nova-compute '
  /usr/bin/env: python -utt: No such file or directory

Revert the change for this script.

Change-Id: I96f82421638581122d687492f7420fd5724a7207
Closes-Bug: #1785245
(cherry picked from commit 9668e7b9bf92257bc1ca9fbb04c973ef698c3dba)
"}]
commit_message:
Revert shebang change for InstanceHA startup script

In Id915ded03ae5a471ffa2dca13e2da90021279f63 the shebang for
check-run-nova-compute has been changed to use /usr/bin/env, which
broke exec'ing the script:

  + exec /var/lib/nova/instanceha/check-run-nova-compute
  Running command: '/var/lib/nova/instanceha/check-run-nova-compute '
  /usr/bin/env: python -utt: No such file or directory

Revert the change for this script.

Change-Id: I96f82421638581122d687492f7420fd5724a7207
Closes-Bug: #1785245
(cherry picked from commit 9668e7b9bf92257bc1ca9fbb04c973ef698c3dba)

commit_message:
Use full cidr for DeployedServerPortMap

In I92ee0f9a2107cdf1ca5903d3756a235a79c36c73 ControlPlaneSubnetCidr
was updated to split on '/'.  Update deployed-server doc to indicate
that DeployedServerPortMap cidr value should use full cidr notation.

Change-Id: Id1b643db00ade4993449d3eadabea5eb5fe827eb

commit_message:
Add more information for InvalidCredentials exception

This commit adds more information for the InvalidCredentials
exception. When users face these errors, these additional information
could be useful to resolve and investigate the issue.

Change-Id: I59c9ccdfcbb361df9d52ef9703245aaf11c693a2

Fix releasenotes build in tox

This patch is to ensure the old files are not left over
when running these document builds.

Use the same timeout as in the legacy job

The legacy job neutron-tempest-multinode-full has a timeout of
10800, so using the same here.

Change-Id: Id4adac059b040d43e7d98a4383cfe0c252fe7588

commit_message:
Add server schema for microversion 2.26

This commit adds servers schema for microversion 2.26
Without those schema in this file, get_schema() method
will throw error about particular schema not found in this file.

Change-Id: I285b303e6b562ad819164c2951cde199ff761c7f
partially-implements: blueprint full-schema-for-all-microversions

[{'created': '2018-08-06 07:16:26.000000000', 'message': "Create a fip with subnet_id and ip specified, the ip is lost

When create a fip with subnet_id and ip option specified, the
created fip won't be the ip specified, in the original code, it
will be replaced with subnet_id, and the ip will arrange by
neutron-server.

Change-Id: I11549903a1f93c5a6a6be2928339c9a6cab43c58
Closes-bug: #1719494
"}]
commit_message:
Create a fip with subnet_id and ip specified, the ip is lost

When create a fip with subnet_id and ip option specified, the
created fip won't be the ip specified, in the original code, it
will be replaced with subnet_id, and the ip will arrange by
neutron-server.

Change-Id: I11549903a1f93c5a6a6be2928339c9a6cab43c58
Closes-bug: #1719494

commit_message:
zuul: Add aio_lxc jobs for distribution installations

These 3 new jobs extend the coverage of the distro installation method
but performing a full aio_lxc OpenStack deployment using the
distribution packages

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/589128/
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/584330/
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages
Change-Id: I3e17f0ccae735cf92ce5fb270c401d7776b5bbd0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-10 16:32:44.000000000', 'message': 'Add namespace isolation for services

This patch ensures pods from namespace X cannot access services
pointing to pods on namespace Y, and vice versa.

The exception are:
- Pods on default namespace can access all the services
- Services on default namespace can be accessed by all the pods

TODO:
- Fix tests

commit_message:
Add namespace isolation for services

This patch ensures pods from namespace X cannot access services
pointing to pods on namespace Y, and vice versa.

The exceptions are:
- Pods on default namespace can access all the services
- Services on default namespace can be accessed by all the pods

Depends-On: I37025bf65b67fe04f2a6d9b14bbe1b7bc387e370
Implements: blueprint openshift-project-isolation-support
Change-Id: I7b78e12cdf2bce5d0780e582814ef51ef0c459a7

commit_message:
Using qemu-kvm on rhel

qemu-kvm-ev was used with centos,
in case of rhel when you have
access to the virtualisation related channels qemu-kvm pulls
qemu-kvm-rhev which is the recommended one.

qemu-kvm-ev was referenced by devstack long time ago,
but the explicit package install on rhel family today
is qemu-kvm and not qemu-kvm-ev.

I am unsure about the other distros, so just changing rhel.

commit_message:
Add release note for port forwardings.

This patch adds a release note for the floating IPs port forwarding
functionality.

Change-Id: I2e0069148cd2551d4534d8a2fd8799f432ffb5e3
Partially-Implements: blueprint port-forwarding
Partial-Bug: #1491317

commit_message:
Move all volume v2 service client unit tests to v3 dir

This patch set is a follow up to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/578993/
which moved the volumes v2 client into v3 and consolidated the
tests.

This patch set does the same for the remaining v2 service clients,
all of which are deprecated. Specifically:

* if there is no v3 version, move the v2 to v3 and change the
  service client import path from v2 to v3
* if there is a v3 version, move the v2 tests into v3 test module
  and delete the v2 test file to avoid test overlap

Change-Id: I2a999a9c41e6b5cd7e2b7b17e338bd697cb262b1

commit_message:
Simplify subclasses for PXERamdiskDeploy

AgentDeploy already inherits from AgentDeployMixin and DeployInterface,
so there's no need to list them here.

Change-Id: Ia76e21330b012bdeb69a3d77b1544575d6d62513

commit_message:
GATE CHECK for quickstart-extras

This change is used to check the health of our gate jobs in the most
direct way possible, by running a real gate on a noop change.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-01 17:55:33.000000000', 'message': 'Create a default share type

Tempest assumes a default share type already created
to work. This means, if a default share type is not
created and not specified in the conf file, tempest
tests fail. A workaround is to create the default share
type as part of the environment setup for all the tests
that need it. This patch set does that.

Change-Id: I15880e400df30918762ebd7304244b4a27200168
Closes-Bug: #1743472

commit_message:
Create a generic share type (api tests)

Tempest assumes a default share type already created
to work. This means, if a default share type is not
created and not specified in the conf file, tempest
tests fail. A workaround is to create a share type
as part of the environment setup for all the tests
that need it. This patch set does that.

Change-Id: I15880e400df30918762ebd7304244b4a27200168
Closes-Bug: #1743472

messages:
[{'account_id': 28783, 'date': '2018-07-27 12:10:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-07-27 12:10:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2018-07-27 13:09:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Nobody ever said it was JSON.'}, {'account_id': 28595, 'date': '2018-07-27 13:23:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

True, but the current returned format is not usable today, and return half a JSON. Why notre return a good JSON so ?'}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2018-07-27 15:32:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I've got to agree with Julien on this - you can't change an expected format so easily without breaking systems that consume it.  If you want to create a story for having an option to export proper JSON to a file, that would be a better approach (and include some unit tests with it).  I know it is a bit more work, but the result would be much more usable and less likely to break someone else."}, {'account_id': 28783, 'date': '2018-07-27 17:34:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28783, 'date': '2018-07-27 18:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2018-07-27 18:08:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

'}]
commit_message:
Unblock Django 2.0 in requirements.txt

Horizon Rocky and FWaaS dashboard support Django 2.0 but requirements.txt
still says Django <2.0 is required. It is out-of-date.
This commit drops unnecessary Django dependencies.
There is no need to install Django explicitly as it is a horizon dependency.

Change-Id: I75b6dd2083863a3ba8acce8b3bf40cd041f44049

subject: Fix race in StackResource delete for Legacy stack
messages:
[{'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-07-12 13:03:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-07-12 13:15:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-07-12 14:49:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-07-12 17:33:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-07-13 14:03:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

This seems to be a duplicate of Rico's patch https://review.openstack.org/508443

Also, we don't update the updated_at time when a stack goes into the DELETE_IN_PROGRESS state, so this won't work. Rico has another patch to address that https://review.openstack.org/509769

I haven't reviewed his stuff because I wasn't sure that changing the updated_at time is the Right Thing (it's an API change, effectively). I had hoped that we might be able to just get rid of races altogether, and I was delaying until after we could discuss it at the PTG. But that discussion revealed that this will be difficult for delete specifically: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/heat-ptg-rocky-race-condition"}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-07-13 14:28:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> This seems to be a duplicate of Rico's patch https://review.openstack.org/508443

Oh I did not notice that though he has added me as reviewer:/ 

Also, we don't update the updated_at time when a stack goes into the DELETE_IN_PROGRESS state, so this won't work. Rico has another patch to address that https://review.openstack.org/509769

Do we need the updated_time for IN_PROGESS state? I think we return False for that[1]

[1] https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/heat/engine/resources/stack_resource.py#L449"}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-07-16 05:30:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Sorry my last comment probably was confusing with the formatting issues.

> Also, we don't update the updated_at time when a stack goes into the DELETE_IN_PROGRESS state, so this won't work.

When the stack goes into DELETE_IN_PROGRESS, we return False from[1] as the condition in[2] would be False.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/heat/engine/resources/stack_resource.py#L449
[2] https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/heat/engine/resources/stack_resource.py#L444-L445

I can abandon this one if we want pursue Rico's patch."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-07-18 19:05:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

If the status changes very quickly from DELETE_FAILED->DELETE_IN_PROGRESS->DELETE_FAILED (so that we never see IN_PROGRESS) then we'll be stuck forever in the "Has the action really started?" loop because the updated_at timestamp never changes.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-07-19 06:31:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> loop because the updated_at timestamp never changes.

Actually, I realized that we set updated_at time[1] for delete too when storing the stack as IN_PROGRESS, in convergence. So not sure how it's going to be different from update.

But it can be remotely possible that timestamp (1. FAILED->2. IN_PROGRESS->3.FAILED), between 1-3 does not change, but I assume we've the same issue for nested stack update.

In legacy we don't update the updated_at when setting the stack as IN_PROGRESS. However, we wait for delete or thread cancel[2] to complete. I can't reproduce the races there, but I assume, we would have the same problems as update would have there.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/heat/engine/stack.py#L1312-L1313"}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-07-21 05:47:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I had a detailed look at the behaviors for different actions:

- We call state_set() when setting something as IN_PROGRESS, COMPLETE or FAILED which does not set the updated_time with the exception of below where we call store(), that sets the updated_time

 - UPDATE IN_PROGRESS where we call store() in legacy
 - converge_stack(), UPDATE/DELETE actions in convergence

Which makes me think that we always assumed updated_time is something that should be only specific to 'UPDATE' action.

However, I failed to understand what was https://bugs.launchpad.net/heat/+bug/1385109 was supposed to fix/change:)?

- I can see this patch resulting in a possible loop as mentioned by you  for legacy DELETE as the updated time does not change from FAILED->IN_PROGRESS->FAILED. However works for convergence as we set the updated_time when setting it to IN_PROGRESS.

I see two options here:

1. Just limit this change for convergence, so it fixes the specific delete race for convergence and legacy is untouched (I could not produce delete race there)

2. Agree that updated_time should be something that should change for all actions (as bug 1385109 meant to) and pursue https://review.openstack.org/509769. Though I think races for all other actions can be handled as part of story/1727142 and related changes.

Wdyt?"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-07-24 00:40:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Which makes me think that we always assumed updated_time is something that should be only specific to 'UPDATE' action.

The CloudFormation API returns CreationTime, LastUpdatedTime (awkward!), and DeletionTime, meaning the times the stack was CREATEd, last UPDATEd and DELETEd respectively. Our DB entries were modelled around that (because we initially supported only a cfn-compatible API). From memory in the beginning we changed updated_at every time the database row was modified, but eventually somebody (probably me) changed it so that heat-cfn-api would have the same semantics as CloudFormation.

Of course cfn (perhaps wisely) doesn't have suspend, resume, or snapshot actions. So I assume that bug 1385109 - which you have no proof I ever saw at the time ;) - was intended to make sure that those actions showed up somehow in a timestamp. It's a fair bet that none of the people involved were cognisant of the semantics of the cfn API.

> I see two options here:

Reading the etherpad https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/heat-ptg-rocky-race-condition again, I see on line 14 that we actually had a plan to get rid of the race altogether in convergence without changing any semantics, and that the legacy delete was the one we thought would be hard to make non-racy.

So if we're only going to solve the convergence case, we should probably do it by eliminating the race (which solves it for all clients) rather than checking for the race in StackResource (which is, after all, only one client)."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-07-24 00:54:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> However, we wait for delete or thread cancel[2] to complete.
>
> [2] https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/heat/engine/service.py#L1403

We don't though because that code is itself run asynchronously:

https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/heat/engine/service.py#L1440

My notes from the PTG suggest that I thought that getting rid of the race altogether would be virtually impossible for legacy deletes (so to fix it we'd have to do something like this + change the updated_at semantics)."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-07-25 02:38:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

>  see on line 14 that we actually had a plan to get rid of the race altogether in convergence without changing any semantics

Would doing that be enough? Though I also mentioned it in the context of delete race, I think this issue would also happen, if a stack update results in a nested stack in DELETE_FAILED, due to something other than an action being cancelled and we would have issue in the next update.

> We don't though because that code is itself run asynchronously

Right, but I've noticed that in legacy the next delete waits till the earlier action is complete(mostly)/canceled, may due to the stack lock."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-07-30 09:17:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> pobably do it by eliminating the race (which solves it for all clients)

After https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582175/, I assume we can abandon this as that would fix the immediate convergence delete issue which this was trying to address.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-08-03 08:20:26.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Fixed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585572/'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-08-05 09:21:32.000000000', 'content': 'Restored

We still need this to fix legacy part'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-08-05 09:24:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-08-05 09:26:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-08-06 07:12:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I think https://review.openstack.org/#/c/586688 changed to set the stacks to IN_PROGRESS before the client call returning for legacy stack too.

I assume we don't need all these changes around updated_time anymore."}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-08-06 16:29:42.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

okay didn't notice https://review.openstack.org/#/c/586688/

for updated_at patches, aim to provide more accurate status update, so they're actually not just for delete race, see https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/1653202"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-08-06 16:38:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> I think https://review.openstack.org/#/c/586688 changed to set the stacks to IN_PROGRESS before the client call returning for legacy stack too.

Not quite.

"For the stack delete operation, do the same *provided that we can acquire the stack lock immediately*, and thus don't need to wait for existing operations to be cancelled before we can change the state to IN_PROGRESS. In other cases *there is still a race*."

So the race still exists when a stack is DELETE_IN_PROGRESS - upon getting another delete we return immediately, and only then stop existing deletes (which marks the stack as DELETE_FAILED), and then go back to DELETE_IN_PROGRESS.

> I assume we don't need all these changes around updated_time anymore.

To fully solve the issue we would definitely need the updated_time thing.

However, I do think we could probably solve it well enough by just putting a delay when the initial status is DELETE_IN_PROGRESS in StackResource that's longer than the timeout for the cancel messages, and don't attempt to read the status until after that delay.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-08-07 06:55:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> to wait for existing operations to be cancelled before we can change the state to IN_PROGRESS

Looks like TREAD_CANCEL does not do anything for DELETE_IN_PROGRESS. So the threads/tasks are either allowed to finish (250s) or they are stopped, which would mark the stack as DELETE_FAILED.

So my impression was we'll leave it that way as this is only for legacy stack."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-12 13:03:16.000000000', 'message': 'Fix race in StackResource delete

A nested stack can be in DELETE_FAILED state due to either a
cancel during delete (iex. change of traversal) or some issue
in delete, When the next delete is re-triggered, if a
check_delete_complete for the StackResource happens before the
nested stack goes into IN_PROGRESS, then the resource and parent
stack would be set as DELETE/UPDATE_FAILED.However, the nested
stack would go on to DELETE_COMPLETE. Most cases the next delete
issued would possibly delete the StackResource.

Check the nested stack previous state and updated_time for delete
as well.

Change-Id: I7e547b1c0697015ecbf66c8f5ee040921ea0eb48
Story: #2002573
Task: 22140

commit_message:
Fix race in StackResource delete for Legacy stack

A nested stack can be in DELETE_FAILED state due to either a
cancel during delete (iex. change of traversal) or some issue
in delete, When the next delete is re-triggered, if a
check_delete_complete for the StackResource happens before the
nested stack goes into IN_PROGRESS, then the resource and parent
stack would be set as DELETE/UPDATE_FAILED.However, the nested
stack would go on to DELETE_COMPLETE. Most cases the next delete
issued would possibly delete the StackResource.

Check the nested stack previous state and updated_time for delete
as well.

Change-Id: I7e547b1c0697015ecbf66c8f5ee040921ea0eb48
Story: #1669608
Task: #17214

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-31 02:49:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fix quotas retrieval for shares and snapshots tables

After refactoring manila-ui plugin to adapt
to the tabbed quotas interface in horizon,
we stopped accesing the usages data structure
which (in horizon side) carries quotas information.
In this patch set we perform quotas control by
querying manilaclient directly.

Change-Id: I2896d54fde0d5e3975afbb7274faadf2a1a81d7c
Closes-Bug: #1783232
Co-Authored-By: Tom Barron <tpb@dyncloud.net>

commit_message:
Fix quotas retrieval for shares and snapshots tables

After refactoring manila-ui plugin to adapt
to the tabbed quotas interface in horizon,
we stopped accesing the usages data structure
which (in horizon side) carries quotas information.
In this patch set we perform quotas control by
querying manilaclient directly.

Change-Id: I2896d54fde0d5e3975afbb7274faadf2a1a81d7c
Closes-Bug: #1783232
Co-Authored-By: Tom Barron <tpb@dyncloud.net>

commit_message:
Ban alembic 0.9.0

alembic 0.9.0 introduces a new protection about uncommited transaction
that doesn't seem to work with stamp().

This change ban the bugged version.

Change-Id: I753ad61d6af73882635edce231c5752b7691df45

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I9bfb80f2556ca7c801dde69d1685751169e25307

commit_message:
Remove PyPI downloads

According to official site,
https://packaging.python.org/guides/analyzing-pypi-package-downloads/
PyPI package download statistics is no longer maintained and thus
should be removed.

Change-Id: Idefa586d3b2ff48d1245226588fa27923b0a0734

commit_message:
Fix CI: Remove tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario005-multinode-oooq

This job was removed by accident in https://review.openstack.org/581376
- and now zuul parser complains the missing job. Remove the job instead
of restoring it, the job is experimental on an old branch.

Change-Id: Ib571dc29ffaf829b670ae9f8ba1b3e5b1075e8d1

commit_message:
Hacking checks for negative test cases

This patchset adds 2 hacking checks for making sure negative
tests have correct conventions applied.

* T117: Check that each negative test has the
  ``@decorators.attr(type=['negative'])`` applied

This patch set adds both hacking checks, adds unit tests
and updates HACKING.rst documentation with both new checks.

Closes-Bug: 1781044
Change-Id: I46df351187d22090861150c84fa0a0c1054ae3d6

commit_message:
Remove dns-integration from NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS

As of now DNS-integration is not supported by networking-odl,
which cause failure of tempest test and require_ext decorator is
not very smart enough to figure out if extension is actually
enabled or not, it just reads the tempest conf and decides regardless
of actual environment. This patch removes dns-integration from
tempest-conf.

Change-Id: If600cc0989ba16606291e83bcc029537d57e5017
Related-Bug: #1785656

Blacklist DNS tests more broadly

There's already some DNS blacklisting so for now disable it more broadly
until it's fixed in the tempest tests.

Closes-Bug: #1785656

messages: [{'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-08-06 01:31:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2018-08-06 21:52:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-08-07 04:13:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-06 01:31:23.000000000', 'message': 'accessbot config: refactor

In responding to some comments on the original changes, it made me
realise that the global "alumni" and "mask" values are not actually
required.  Each channel looks up these values in the global dictionary
first, which is the correct place to put them.

This moves them into the global dictionary, but also adds and updates
(removes stackforge references) more details about what's happening
with the channel config keys.

Change-Id: Ic8fc5022d670e0dbcbb53ef803125317dfc008f7
'}]
commit_message:
accessbot config: refactor

In responding to some comments on the original changes, it made me
realise that the global "alumni" and "mask" values are not actually
required.  Each channel looks up these values in the global dictionary
first, which is the correct place to put them.

This moves them into the global dictionary, but also adds and updates
(removes stackforge references) more details about what's happening
with the channel config keys.

Change-Id: Ic8fc5022d670e0dbcbb53ef803125317dfc008f7

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-04 00:24:18.000000000', 'message': 'Test replica engine status retry on 503

Tempest failures occassionally occur because when the
freshly started replica server is unresponsive,
the tempest code does not retry.

This patch adds the retry.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/588847/
Change-Id: I5e01412d7dbd66e2ddae99860f0d58f5b2800ab0
'}]
commit_message:
Test replica engine status retry on 503

Tempest failures occassionally occur because when the
freshly started replica server is unresponsive,
the tempest code does not retry.

This patch adds the retry.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/588847/
Change-Id: I5e01412d7dbd66e2ddae99860f0d58f5b2800ab0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-05 20:40:27.000000000', 'message': 'Reuse the RPC transport to create RPC client

In before, we created a PRC transport per RPC call. This causes
too many RPC connections as reported by the bug. This patch fixes
it by initialize the RPC transport at startup and reuse the RPC
transport for each API call.

Change-Id: I55e409e0b70024673bd25ab460c2a5bfecc717a5
Closes-Bug: #1785371
'}]
commit_message:
Reuse the RPC transport to create RPC client

In before, we created a PRC transport per RPC call. This causes
too many RPC connections as reported by the bug. This patch fixes
it by initialize the RPC transport at startup and reuse the RPC
transport for each API call.

Change-Id: I55e409e0b70024673bd25ab460c2a5bfecc717a5
Closes-Bug: #1785371

[{'created': '2018-08-06 07:30:41.000000000', 'message': "Define irrelevant-files for tempest-full-py3 job

tempest-full-py3 job runs on nova check and gate pipeline
as part of 'integrated-gate-py35' template.

Like tempest-full or other job, nova job definition list on
project-config side[1] does not define the irrelevant-files for
tempest-full-py job which leads to run this job on doc/test file
only change also.

This commit defines the irrelevant-files for tempest-full-py3 on
nova's zuul.yaml.

commit_message:
Define irrelevant-files for tempest-full-py3 job

tempest-full-py3 job runs on nova check and gate pipeline
as part of 'integrated-gate-py35' template.

Unlike tempest-full or other job, nova job definition list on
project-config side[1] does not define the irrelevant-files for
tempest-full-py job which leads to run this job on doc/test file
only change also.

This commit defines the irrelevant-files for tempest-full-py3 on
nova's zuul.yaml.

Closes-Bug: #1785425

[1] https://github.com/openstack-infra/project-config/blob/57907fbf04c3f9a69d390efee800d42697faae16/zuul.d/projects.yaml#L9283

Change-Id: I887177c078a53c53e84289a6b134d7ea357dfbef

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I8b0f96f05799b892acfae03522726c17010f0df3

commit_message:
Delete check of function alias

This commit add function alias check of delete function and delete
function version, if there is alias associated with the function or
function version, the function or function version  deletion will
fail.

Change-Id: Ic45f5e0bcf30266fccd7b1ed649e79f94eaccdc3
Story: #2002143
Task: 23265

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-06 16:48:51.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I9a4a3726a43318786ce3db0f2283225bc1a2f3dc
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I9a4a3726a43318786ce3db0f2283225bc1a2f3dc

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I96e96b197c418b0fe411b54d1d3fd7e98320be51
Story: #2003250

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-04 10:37:59.000000000', 'message': "Not use project table for user table

`GET /resource_provider/{uuid}/allocations` API didn't
return all the allocations made by multiple users.

This was because the placement wrongly used project table
for user table. This patch fixes it with the test case.

Change-Id: I7c808dec5de1204ced0d1f1b31d8398de8c51679
Closes-Bug: #1785382
"}]
commit_message:
Not use project table for user table

`GET /resource_provider/{uuid}/allocations` API didn't
return all the allocations made by multiple users.

This was because the placement wrongly used project table
for user table. This patch fixes it with the test case.

Change-Id: I7c808dec5de1204ced0d1f1b31d8398de8c51679
Closes-Bug: #1785382

commit_message:
Fix neutron-lbaas tempest for filter validation

Neutron recently enabled filter validation[1] which caused the
neutron-lbaas tempest gates to fail due to an incorrect filter. This
patch corrects that filter.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574907/

Change-Id: I93f4ad75398c634305dc829b3db1dd2ba3575184

commit_message:
Fix lock leaks in unit tests

Following message was seen during unit tests:
"BUG: node lock was not released by the moment node info object is deleted."

Though the bug was marked invalid before, apparently it had never been resolved.
Tests involved in this patch were located by saving stack at NodeInfo.__init__ and
printing out at NodeInfo.__del__, without promises, but hopefully covers all tests
in current repo.

Change-Id: I678407b350bd07926eb98db30f24cc83747fa84c
Story: #1533595
Task: #11296

`GET /resource_provider/{uuid}/allocations` API currently doesn't

Partial-Bug: #1785382

commit_message:
Adds a test for getting allocations API

`GET /resource_provider/{uuid}/allocations` API currently doesn't
return all the allocations made by multiple users.

This patch adds a test to describe this bug. The fix for this
is coming in a follow up.

Change-Id: I2b01e27922f11bef2defcb01fe415692de1578ea
Partial-Bug: #1785382

[{'created': '2018-07-11 16:28:52.000000000', 'message': 'use fqdn for zuul projects

When setting up a 3pci zuul, there is an edge case where a downstream
zuul may already have openstack/foo projects, eg:
review.rdoproject.org/openstack/foo.  In this case, if openstack
projects are not namespaced to include the connection information zuul
gets confused and complains.  We can avoid this by using the fqdn for
git.o.o for devstack jobs and both upstream and downstream zuul will
properly use the correct connection.

Change-Id: If7ca3bdad124efecc93b1f5c70c2e6d2c927886c
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
use fqdn for zuul projects

When setting up a 3pci zuul, there is an edge case where a downstream
zuul may already have openstack/foo projects, eg:
review.rdoproject.org/openstack/foo.  In this case, if openstack
projects are not namespaced to include the connection information zuul
gets confused and complains.  We can avoid this by using the fqdn for
git.o.o for devstack jobs and both upstream and downstream zuul will
properly use the correct connection.

Change-Id: If7ca3bdad124efecc93b1f5c70c2e6d2c927886c
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Clarify that the driver support library is interim

This patch is intended to clarify that Octavia is a service project
and not a library. It clarifies that the driver support callbacks are
temporary and will be removed in favor of a driver support endpoint.

Change-Id: Ic9dc596e86d414da1e8e20562f10ad490c51dbd9

commit_message:
Cleanup Octavia create VIP ports on LB delete

This patch updates the Octavia load balancer VIP handling to deallocate
the VIP if it was created by Octavia. User provided or provider driver
supplied VIPs will not be deallocated.

Change-Id: Idb62a53197975a4aa52fbc3fb5ee192f261b08d8

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-03 15:19:21.000000000', 'message': 'Remove Ansible function jobs from cloud-launcher

The cloud-launcher needs a devstack deployment in order to be
able to run properly therefore the jobs listed never pass.

The jobs have been migrated and moved off to the repo but
those need to be removed first in order for the change that
adds the new working jobs to pass.

Change-Id: I45bd413bd468963be1cb11764291dad2f7bf2fbc
Needed-By: I5c714eb0732f345f56b9b0b9afa12ad1cc08fcdf
'}]
commit_message:
Remove Ansible function jobs from cloud-launcher

The cloud-launcher needs a devstack deployment in order to be
able to run properly therefore the jobs listed never pass.

The jobs have been migrated and moved off to the repo but
those need to be removed first in order for the change that
adds the new working jobs to pass.

Change-Id: I45bd413bd468963be1cb11764291dad2f7bf2fbc
Needed-By: I5c714eb0732f345f56b9b0b9afa12ad1cc08fcdf

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-09 16:12:18.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I82ee92a451723ad895f017d5de9debcec3e9b8a2
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I82ee92a451723ad895f017d5de9debcec3e9b8a2

commit_message:
New preflight check for the undercloud: disk space

Enable disk space check on the undercloud in order to ensure we have
at least the minimal at disposal.
The check itself comes from the tripleo-validations repository in order
to avoid inconsistencies and do a first step toward ansible-driven
validations.

Change-Id: Ieea72ce2695683c5fb083887195044acbd6b92ee

commit_message:
[placement] ensure_rc_cache only at start of process

Call ensure_rc_cache from deploy, so that we only try it once per
process.

A small number of unit tests needed an adjustment to either mock
properly or call the ensure_rc_cache in advance of their work.

Change-Id: I7499bba6ac6b463d8da46e10469121e62ee52ed1

commit_message:
Switch to using project-templates

In order to have more centralized configuration, switch the role
to use the project-template instead.

Mark newly introduced failing checks as non-voting.

Change-Id: I946570d91fe01f39952ee100a02831bad36f126d

[{'created': '2018-08-03 07:35:59.000000000', 'message': "Do not allow create limits for domain

Keystone now doesn't support domain-level limits. When creating
limits, if the input project_id is a domain id, it should not be
allowed.

Change-Id: Ifafd96113499d533341870960f294dd5fada477d
Closes-Bug: #1785164
"}]
commit_message:
Do not allow create limits for domain

Keystone now doesn't support domain-level limits. When creating
limits, if the input project_id is a domain id, it should not be
allowed.

Change-Id: Ifafd96113499d533341870960f294dd5fada477d
Closes-Bug: #1785164

[{'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-08-02 17:38:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-08-02 17:58:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Seems like a useful thing to have with the caveat that logging by request groups alone is not useful for the common case of "boot me a simple vm on a simple host" where request groups won't be a thing and that for the complex cases, it will be some time before the nova-side is fully reporting and expressing that kind of thing.

However, it is also likely the case that it is when things are all nesty and stuff that people are more likely to need/want this kind of debugging.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-08-02 18:23:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Right: one specific concern from the ML thread [1] is around complex scenarios (e.g. NUMA) for which nestiness will surely come into play.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-August/132801.html'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-08-02 18:40:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
[placement] Debug log per granular request group

Add a debug log as suggested in [1]: for each granular request group, it
prints how many allocation requests matched. See sample output [2].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-August/132802.html
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/raw/727229/

Change-Id: I89d2892fabb6273bfa793f4a06dced80b68e93d5

commit_message:
Switch to using project-templates

In order to have more centralized configuration, switch the role
to use the project-template instead.

Mark newly introduced failing jobs as non-voting.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/588962
Change-Id: I559d19d38a419a373d5cbb3d9f423607f8d29a74

Mount /usr/lib/heat on undercloud Heat

We need the tripleo common on the undercloud heat, let's mount an
additional volume to share them.

commit_message:
Handle negative/wrong answer in question when upgrading undercloud.

When upgrading the heat-based undercloud a security
question is asked to stop the upgrade if a undercloud
backup was not performed. This patch handles the case
when a negative or wrong answer is provided,
raising a new UndercloudUpradeNotConfirmed exception
which is then captured and displays an informative
log notifying that the upgrade didn't take place.
Also, removing the format call when the undercloud
upgrades fails [0] as the called string message
doesn't need parametrization.

[0] - https://github.com/openstack/python-tripleoclient/blob/03254c84f6c6822b7b87476d4597a19fd2eb5983/tripleoclient/v1/undercloud.py#L158

Change-Id: I80ae52e8a732b2827e8179ce024f92ed52a29394
Closes-Bug: #1783722

commit_message:
Switch to using project-templates

In order to have more centralized configuration, switch the role
to use the project-template instead.

This role is very special in that none of the functional tests are
voting.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/588962
Change-Id: Ib26b42aa4d74beaecf9c06cc3114eee32fffb01b

commit_message:
SSL support for novnc proxy

To support novnc proxy TLS/SSL enc connections ssl_only and cert
needs to be configured. If ssl_only is True we also need to provide
a cert bundle.

Change-Id: Iae033514faaf4d823259a15e81cbbca2cf83046c
Closes-bug: 1785700

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-02 07:14:37.000000000', 'message': 'Increase max_unit in placement test fixture

In the AllocationFixture setup, to avoid the limitation of the
max_unit that is set to the inventory, we were using a bit hacky
way creating multiple allocation objects that have the same resource
class, the same consumer, and the same resource provider.

Since this is not how it works in real cases, and this prevents us
from refactoring, this patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I8ba378ff5eeaf6c9cca11c5874708a17d4640097
'}]
commit_message:
Increase max_unit in placement test fixture

In the AllocationFixture setup, to avoid the limitation of the
max_unit that is set to the inventory, we were using a bit hacky
way creating multiple allocation objects that have the same resource
class, the same consumer, and the same resource provider.

Since this is not how it works in real cases, and this prevents us
from refactoring, this patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I8ba378ff5eeaf6c9cca11c5874708a17d4640097

subject: Remove use_mox directive
messages:
[{'account_id': 24, 'date': '2018-07-23 10:53:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24, 'date': '2018-07-26 11:41:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2018-08-02 21:58:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

mox must have been removed from 14.0.0.0.b1, why bump the requirement?
See recently merged change here: https://github.com/openstack/manila-ui/commit/09695532764d523c1b102ff9512ed9682e845c04

It's good to remove the "use_mox" directive, it's useless by the looks of it'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2018-08-02 22:23:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-08-03 00:23:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

> mox must have been removed from 14.0.0.0.b1, why bump the requirement?
> See recently merged change here: https://github.com/openstack/manila-ui/commit/09695532764d523c1b102ff9512ed9682e845c04

In horizon 14.0.0.0b1, mox usage became optional but the default value of use_mox was True, so a horizon plugin needs to specify use_mox = False explicitly to make it mox-free.
In horizon 14.0.0.b2, use_mox now defaults to False. if a horizon plugin is already mox-free, use_mox = False is no longer required.

> It's good to remove the "use_mox" directive, it's useless by the looks of it

As mentioned above, if you use horizon 14.0.0.0b2 or later, use_mox is now unnecessary.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-08-03 00:34:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-08-03 09:26:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Yes, please change the commit message to say that 'use_mox' variable is no longer needed with horizon 14.0.0.0b2 so it is being removed and the requirement is being bumped accordingly.  Also indicate that manila-ui has already met the community goal since it has not had any mox imports since March 2015.

Do we need to change our Django requirement to add the 'python_version' markers to match what horizon has?  http://logs.openstack.org/95/584795/2/check/requirements-check/d27eec1/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-07-26_12_11_42_942077"}, {'account_id': 24, 'date': '2018-08-03 12:53:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-08-03 20:06:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Thanks for fixing the commit message.  Repeating my requirements question since we really want to get this in to a Rocky cycle release:

How can we get this patch not to fail on the requirements-check?

Do we need to change our Django requirement to add the 'python_version' markers to match what horizon has? http://logs.openstack.org/95/584795/2/check/requirements-check/d27eec1/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-07-26_12_11_42_942077"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-08-04 12:08:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-08-04 12:12:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I proposed a patch to drop explicit Django dependency from manila-ui requirements.txt in https://review.openstack.org/588892'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-08-04 12:16:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-08-04 12:57:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Code-Review

Looks good, please see my question regarding lower-constraints in the other patch though.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-08-04 13:42:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 26431, 'date': '2018-08-06 01:28:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2018-08-06 19:58:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Remove use_mox directive

As of horizon 14.0.0.0b2 or later the use_mox directive is
unecessary so we can remove it.

So remove it from the manila-ui and bump the requirements to b2.

Change-Id: I90b62737f6af94bec7d374742148cea480d65c99
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Drop Django depdency from requirements.txt

Horizon depends on Django and manila-ui depends on horizon,
so we don't need to have Django dependency explicitly.
In Rocky cycle, horizon supports Django 2.x and manila-ui has not
followed it yet. It is a good chance to drop explicit Django dependency.

Change-Id: Idedf03bf2b34d4756eafd4d6694286e14e6eaa68

By setting this to zero we are moving to we are moving to:
