Change-Id: If04a7bf24a5c94ec15726843a8a4d2504b656cb7
'}, {'created': '2018-07-26 07:22:21.000000000', 'message': 'Set default number of rabbitmq queues to CEIL(N/2)

The default used to be -1 which translated to 'ha-mode: all'.
That means that every queue is mirrored on all controllers.

By setting this to zero we are moving to 'ha-mode: exactly' with
the number of queues to be set to CEIL(N/2):
$nr_ha_queues = CEIL(nr_of_rabbit_nodes/2)
set_policy='ha-all ^(?!amq\\.).* {\"ha-mode\":\"exactly\",\"ha-params\":${nr_ha_queues}}'

This way the queues will not be copied around all servers,
but just to a subset of them. This still provides the necessary
resilience in case of a controller crash, but is less demanding
in terms of performance (and likely triggers fewer bugs in rabbit)

Co-Authored-By: John Eckersberg <jeckersb@redhat.com>

Change-Id: If04a7bf24a5c94ec15726843a8a4d2504b656cb7
'}]
commit_message:
Set default number of rabbitmq queues to CEIL(N/2)

The default used to be -1 which translated to 'ha-mode: all'.
That means that every queue is mirrored on all controllers.

By setting this to zero we are moving to 'ha-mode: exactly' with
the number of queues to be set to CEIL(N/2):
$nr_ha_queues = CEIL(nr_of_rabbit_nodes/2)
set_policy='ha-all ^(?!amq\\.).* {\"ha-mode\":\"exactly\",\"ha-params\":${nr_ha_queues}}'

This way the queues will not be copied around all servers,
but just to a subset of them. This still provides the necessary
resilience in case of a controller crash, but is less demanding
in terms of performance (and likely triggers fewer bugs in rabbit)

Co-Authored-By: John Eckersberg <jeckersb@redhat.com>

Change-Id: If04a7bf24a5c94ec15726843a8a4d2504b656cb7

commit_message:
Remove parameter for ceph-ansible playbook from update/upgrade prepare

The parameter was necessary before we inherited the update/upgrade
prepare commands from the deploy command. Nowadays this is not
necessary and can be achieved by 2 different means: either via the
*-prepare.yaml files setting CephAnsiblePlaybook parameter, or via
external_update_tasks and external_upgrade_tasks.

Partial-Bug: #1783949
Change-Id: If54e12dbac1a982e89d29b96d86f9f5299e3d810
Depends-On: If80f9cc2f4cb32610dc5eb87159872e28363a21a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-04 00:13:04.000000000', 'message': 'Return 503 if engine overloaded/unresponsive

When the policy engine is present, but an RPC call to it in the
course of fulfilling an API request times out, the error code
returned to the API caller is 404 rather than the more
appropriate 503 (service (temporarily) unavailable).

Change-Id: I5545500ff1c1a4b6e846b810319ad52218ed70fa
Closes-Bug: 1785345
'}]
commit_message:
Return 503 if engine overloaded/unresponsive

When the policy engine is present, but an RPC call to it in the
course of fulfilling an API request times out, the error code
returned to the API caller is 404 rather than the more
appropriate 503 (service (temporarily) unavailable).

Change-Id: I5545500ff1c1a4b6e846b810319ad52218ed70fa
Closes-Bug: 1785345

For offline installs, or when using local mirrors, the
variable repo_build_pip_default_index will be set to the
local pypi mirror.

Instead of falling back to pypi, we should fall back to
whatever the repo build is set to use. This gives a more
consistent and user-friendly experience.

(cherry picked from commit cf107874ed4116768d913d7ab0593b6cd4ee4977)
'}]
commit_message:
Use repo_build_pip_default_index for the pypi fallback

For offline installs, or when using local mirrors, the
variable repo_build_pip_default_index will be set to the
local pypi mirror.

Instead of falling back to pypi, we should fall back to
whatever the repo build is set to use. This gives a more
consistent and user-friendly experience.

Change-Id: Iddac2cc46aa1eb1466ef9e956c01618ef4deac99
(cherry picked from commit cf107874ed4116768d913d7ab0593b6cd4ee4977)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-01 10:58:32.000000000', 'message': "Reload oslo_context after calling monkey_patch()

oslo.context is storing a global thread-local variable which keeps the
request context for the current thread. If oslo.context is imported
before calling monkey_patch(), then this thread-local won't be green and
instead of having one request per green thread, we will have one request
object which will be overwritten every time when a new context is
created.

To workaround the problem, always reload oslo_context.context after
calling monkey_patch() to make sure it uses green thread locals.

Change-Id: Id059e5576c3fc78dd893fde15c963e182f1157f6
Closes-Bug: #1773102
"}]
commit_message:
Reload oslo_context after calling monkey_patch()

oslo.context is storing a global thread-local variable which keeps the
request context for the current thread. If oslo.context is imported
before calling monkey_patch(), then this thread-local won't be green and
instead of having one request per green thread, we will have one request
object which will be overwritten every time when a new context is
created.

To workaround the problem, always reload oslo_context.context after
calling monkey_patch() to make sure it uses green thread locals.

Change-Id: Id059e5576c3fc78dd893fde15c963e182f1157f6
Closes-Bug: #1773102

commit_message:
Support health check for Docker containers

The docker has supported healthcheck. It is useful for application
container.
Zun may integrate these options.

  --health-cmd Command to run to check health
  --health-interval Time between running the check
  --health-retries Consecutive failures needed to report unhealthy
  --health-timeout Maximum time to allow one check to run
  In zun, the four parameter are cmd, interval, retries, timeout.

Partial-Implements: blueprint support-healthycheck

Change-Id: I2f9f48aef17f0d92835db13c6112550bda5e31bf

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-03 23:51:28.000000000', 'message': "Don't wait for task in submit_task

The exception shifting performed by the Task class is meant to
protect the TaskManager run method from encountering any exceptions
done in the course of running a task.  This is especially important
for subclasses of TaskManager which implement alternate run
strategies.  The exception is shifted so that it is raised by the
Task.wait method.  In a multi-thread environment, it is the caller
of the submit_task method which should receive the exception, and
therefore it is submit_task which should call Task.wait.  Currently
it is the _run_task method which calls Task.wait, which means the
TaskManager itself receives the exception.

Change-Id: I3a6e61601164811fdd255ae54470011768c99a7d

"}, {'created': '2018-08-06 15:44:40.000000000', 'message': "Don't wait for task in submit_task

TaskManager itself receives the exception.

Change-Id: I3a6e61601164811fdd255ae54470011768c99a7d

commit_message:
Don't wait for task in submit_task

The exception shifting performed by the Task class is meant to
protect the TaskManager run method from encountering any exceptions
done in the course of running a task.  This is especially important
for subclasses of TaskManager which implement alternate run
strategies.  The exception is shifted so that it is raised by the
Task.wait method.  In a multi-thread environment, it is the caller
of the submit_task method which should receive the exception, and
therefore it is submit_task which should call Task.wait.  Currently
it is the _run_task method which calls Task.wait, which means the
TaskManager itself receives the exception.

Change-Id: I3a6e61601164811fdd255ae54470011768c99a7d

commit_message:
When using multipath, detach volume failure

Steps to reproduce:

1. use multipath service

2. Create a container with a volume, then delete it

3. Use the same volume to create a new container, it will fail

Closes-Bug: #1784334

Change-Id: I97551b72f9532b86658e997052d9937e658dc415

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-02 08:22:27.000000000', 'message': 'Execute network setup against octavia_service_setup_host

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we use service delegation to octavia_service_setup_host so that instead
of installing software on the target host, and putting credentials on
every target host, we isolate the software and credentials to a single
host.

In this patch we make the network tasks execute using clouds.yaml so that
we do not need to expose the credentials in the task (it will leak the
credentials in vebose mode or on failure). We also set the tasks to execute
on octavia_service_setup_host so that we do not need as much software
installed on the target host.

There are any other tasks in the role which need updating before we can
eliminate the octavia_requires_pip_packages, but for the sake of keeping
the patch smaller and easier to review they will be done in follow up
patches.

Change-Id: I07f0907a3841f81c0f76a25ce89de9f1145c35f9
'}]
commit_message:
Execute network setup against octavia_service_setup_host

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we use service delegation to octavia_service_setup_host so that instead
of installing software on the target host, and putting credentials on
every target host, we isolate the software and credentials to a single
host.

In this patch we make the network tasks execute using clouds.yaml so that
we do not need to expose the credentials in the task (it will leak the
credentials in vebose mode or on failure). We also set the tasks to execute
on octavia_service_setup_host so that we do not need as much software
installed on the target host.

There are any other tasks in the role which need updating before we can
eliminate the octavia_requires_pip_packages, but for the sake of keeping
the patch smaller and easier to review they will be done in follow up
patches.

Change-Id: I07f0907a3841f81c0f76a25ce89de9f1145c35f9

messages: [{'account_id': 6968, 'date': '2018-06-11 11:24:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-06-11 12:25:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6968, 'date': '2018-06-14 15:51:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 17499, 'date': '2018-06-15 03:21:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-08-06 12:31:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-11 11:24:29.000000000', 'message': 'Add host_prep_task to setup proper logging for Swift

Recent overcloud images seem to be more lightweight, and the
openstack-swift-*.rpms are no longer installed. However, these rpms
created an entry in /etc/rsyslog.d/openstack-swift.conf, which ensures
that Swift logs are actually written to /var/log/swift/swift.log

This file is now missing, and thus logs mess up /var/log/messages.

Closes-Bug: 1776180
Change-Id: Icf4310558e3cceafbdd67f72432e59730b96a588
'}]
commit_message:
Add host_prep_task to setup proper logging for Swift

Recent overcloud images seem to be more lightweight, and the
openstack-swift-*.rpms are no longer installed. However, these rpms
created an entry in /etc/rsyslog.d/openstack-swift.conf, which ensures
that Swift logs are actually written to /var/log/swift/swift.log

This file is now missing, and thus logs mess up /var/log/messages.

Closes-Bug: 1776180
Change-Id: Icf4310558e3cceafbdd67f72432e59730b96a588

messages:
[{'account_id': 28493, 'date': '2018-06-16 20:54:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-06-16 20:55:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2018-06-16 20:59:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2018-06-18 12:52:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-06-19 15:13:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-06-20 11:51:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-08-06 12:29:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Fluentd: Set cinder-backup log path

Cinder-backup service does not provide the path of the log
so fluentd does not read it.

This patch makes fluentd to know where the log are for the cinder-backup service

Change-Id: I6aae8f2614fbca425595e56e565216c70b30b4d6
Closes-Bug: #1781019

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because of that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I5e1239212b5a32c623cf00bf3cb0a56362a3e320

commit_message:
Drop obsolete environment for `overcloud ceph-upgrade run`

After switching from Heat workflow resources to external_deploy_tasks,
the `ceph-upgrade run` command no longer works and can be
dropped. Instead we'll be using `external-update run` and
`external-upgrade run` commands, which will not do stack update. It
will run Ansible and for Ceph specifically it will set the necessary
playbook directly via Ansible.

Partial-Bug: #1783949
Change-Id: I3490163bc426d070e245387201d64e07b908c74f
Depends-On: I228ce6228d0bd0bd4d40bc7a7cdd6bfe98a7a6ed

commit_message:
remove freezer and searchlight from rocky

The release team is going to remove freezer and searchlight from the
rocky release because they missed too many deadlines. We should also
remove them from the documentation.

Change-Id: I915750fb753fcadb1e5ae068485c7901f9eabbf5
Depends-On: I94953b879451f6d34d0917a14bcbea1a1566400b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Id456fc88170c4466a434100934e150f403e7ecd9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9940c4e78f6d0d3dad1572a2e32f3c61b0464b30)

commit_message:
Add native Zuul v3 build and publishing jobs

The new jobs replace (and move in-tree):
- legacy-sahara-extra-artifacts
- legacy-post-sahara-extra-artifacts

Unfortunately the new publish job can't be tested
beforehand, but we can fix it later.

Story: 2001686
Task: 8660

This change backports the original commit from master
and its subsequent necessary fix:
(cherry picked from commit 90c2430bc9f752023dfcf89faf7ee37cf2ca2f3f)
(cherry picked from commit 5370554703ec31d90aca25cf0f99812c38cb11fe)

commit_message:
Ignore RESOLVE translation errors when translating before_props

When translating name to id, if we don't find the resource it's
better to ignore the error and return the non-translated value
for before properties.

Change-Id: Ic25c35098cff8b68e184a336b21f2e8df70bb1ee
Story: #2003015
Task: 23103
(cherry picked from commit 8c39f3bb8b08ad37cb5411b448ef2acde6345d55)

commit_message:
WIP: Add networking-odl for bgpvpn stable jobs

On networking-bgpvpn stable branches the jobs require networking-odl to
be added as required projects otherwise they fail:

pep8: http://logs.openstack.org/68/572368/1/check/openstack-tox-pep8/8a8ef13/tox/pep8-1.log
py27: http://logs.openstack.org/68/572368/1/check/openstack-tox-py27/a8c9075/tox/py27-1.log
py35: http://logs.openstack.org/68/572368/1/check/openstack-tox-py35/bbe883c/tox/py35-1.log
tox-cover: http://logs.openstack.org/68/572368/1/check/openstack-tox-cover/3fe6703/tox/cover-1.log
sphinx: http://logs.openstack.org/68/572368/1/check/build-openstack-sphinx-docs/db1477d/job-output.json.gz

Nevertheless tox_install.sh would install networking-odl but it seems
to be to late for the jobs.

Change-Id: I5a13d4fa26992cb90caeba98fa7e34af05ca5b74

Add OpenSUSE Leap 15 support

This adds OpenSUSE Leap 15 support in the code.
No image for OpenSUSE Leap 15 is built in gates, as this
will be included in a latter commit.

messages: [{'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-08-03 22:05:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-08-06 16:45:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-26 12:42:10.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I083a7c90bb7ee162fecf131aad037f8ea14e1492
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I083a7c90bb7ee162fecf131aad037f8ea14e1492

commit_message:
remove freezer and searchlight from rocky series

As discussed in the team meeting on 3 Aug, both Freezer and Searchlight
missed enough milestone deadlines this cycle to be dropped from the
official set of projects for the release. This patch removes the
deliverable files for those projects.

Change-Id: I94953b879451f6d34d0917a14bcbea1a1566400b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-04-17 19:21:16.000000000', 'message': 'Make server groups api aware of multiple cells for membership

This teaches the server groups api to query all of the cells that have
an instance claiming to be a member of the group. Instead of polling all
cells, this collects the subset of cells that actually have members,
according to our InstanceMapping data, and then checks for the deleted-ness
in the actual cell database.

This augments the tests to have one instance in each cell, plus an instance
that is not yet scheduled in any cell to give us coverage of all the
possibilities.

This replaces the prevuously-flawed and now reverted change:

  If571f9e7c9d0ef6265a249ff808d30a24ab462af

Change-Id: Idd2e35bc95ed98ebc0340ff62e109e23c8adcb21

commit_message:
Make server groups api aware of multiple cells for membership

This teaches the server groups api to query all of the cells that have
an instance claiming to be a member of the group. Instead of polling all
cells, this collects the subset of cells that actually have members,
according to our InstanceMapping data, and then checks for the deleted-ness
in the actual cell database.

This augments the tests to have one instance in each cell, plus an instance
that is not yet scheduled in any cell to give us coverage of all the
possibilities.

This replaces the previously-flawed and now reverted change:

  If571f9e7c9d0ef6265a249ff808d30a24ab462af

Change-Id: Idd2e35bc95ed98ebc0340ff62e109e23c8adcb21

commit_message:
WIP: only _init_compute_node on startup

Another approach to attempting to reduce the number of redundant calls
to _update(), this one uses the new `startup` kwarg to
_update_available_resource to condition _init_compute_node to run only
on startup.

I suspect that the _copy_resources part of _init_compute_node is
actually important to be run every time, so I'm doing that outside
(redundantly - possible opportunity for removing it from within
_init_compute_node).

Change-Id: Ie4c7fb2d7a1a4e48d4ada176a567a8999d01bc89

The router id for the dragent must be on the provider network. The
charm was using the BGP speaker_ip which is only used for related
test services. (i.e. quagga).

This change guarantees the router id uses the provider extra binding
IP.

It also sets the group ownership to neutron for rendered config files.

cherry picked from commit ba7b42e36c1d527433852e3fbb93b64248b9f9b7

Closes-Bug: #1782433
Partial-Bug: #1782444
Change-Id: I4761b4c5b80a398e13e4cdf880b773df489f53b9
'}]
commit_message:
Use the provider network for router id

The router id for the dragent must be on the provider network. The
charm was using the BGP speaker_ip which is only used for related
test services. (i.e. quagga).

This change guarantees the router id uses the provider extra binding
IP.

It also sets the group ownership to neutron for rendered config files.

cherry picked from commit ba7b42e36c1d527433852e3fbb93b64248b9f9b7

Closes-Bug: #1782433
Partial-Bug: #1782444
Change-Id: I4761b4c5b80a398e13e4cdf880b773df489f53b9

commit_message:
Reset ntp_client cached token in override_role context

As bug [0] shows we have incorrect behaviour with client, when its
allowed to perform forbidden action beacause of cached token.
This patchset expands RbacUtilsMixin with `get_auth_providers` so
we can define additional auth_providers on testcase level.
Using it we reset cached auth data for neutron-tempest-plugin
client in *PluginRbacTest tests.

[0] https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2003296

Change-Id: Ie444f1e0be1c9a5ff7fc8a968269b73f510685e3
Story: 2003296
Task: 24245

Change-Id: Ibbeee913afc463705fe781c2ef0918deb1303617
Story: 2003314

commit_message:
Fix service_type normalization

The previous version of the function would fail poorly when service_type
is None. Put in an if to fix it.

Change-Id: Ibbeee913afc463705fe781c2ef0918deb1303617
Story: 2003314

commit_message:
Fix OpenStack Summit Berlin schedule

The OpenStack Summit Berlin will be held on November 13-15, 2018.
It will be in R-21, not in R-22.

Change-Id: Iddcf65c2bfe0656f79abbff16f2bc5d9d0a20800

The class FakeInfinisdkException is used in the tests code to mock the
exceptions raised by infinisdk (our internal library for connecting to
the InfiniBox REST API). In earlier versions, this exception was
implemented by inhereting from the base Exception class and

The class FakeInfinisdkException is used in the tests code to mock the
exceptions raised by infinisdk (our internal library for connecting to

implemented by inhereting from the base Exception class and

Change-Id: I44059d41143eaee6d7dcb073e21c9c840dacae3e
'}]
commit_message:
INFINIDAT: unit tests - remove fake exception body

The class FakeInfinisdkException is used in the tests code to mock the
exceptions raised by infinisdk (our internal library for connecting to
the InfiniBox REST API). In earlier versions, this exception was
implemented by inhereting from the base Exception class and
implementing its constructor, however, this code is redundant,
and basic inherithance should do.

Change-Id: I44059d41143eaee6d7dcb073e21c9c840dacae3e

commit_message:
Work around nested virt issues on OVH test nodes

OVH nodepool nodes have an issue which causes nested virt
instances to crash with a hardware error, then a dump.
We therefore detect whether we're running on OVH and
force it to use qemu instead.

Change-Id: I54681092adf9c0647bf65583176ddc21c99494f3

commit_message:
Run with KVM if we can in tests

We should not Set nova_virt_type.
This way detection steps in, and kvm is used.

However, we should use qemu for OVH hosts:
There seem to be a bug in some OVH hosts
causing 'hardware error 0x0' when trying to run with kvm.

Change-Id: I4f679815ac55095000dc1017cebbd1a8bf0f6c5f

commit_message:
DNM: Explore limiting resource tracker update

This adds an 'update_tree' keyword to _update so that it is
possible to skip reporting to placement as it has already been doing
once in this periodic job.

This is just exploratory to see what, if anything, blows up. pep8
failures are expected.

Change-Id: Id90c6a32d609df3e45d80c80831f99ec6886d0cf

commit_message:
Remove redundant _update()s

_update is always being called at the end of
rt._update_available_resource, so there should be no need to call it
from _init_compute_node, which is always (and only) called at the
*start* of rt._update_available_resource.

Change-Id: I04a4a455df2201ee03400365c5bef2e431d51b90

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Id23710170c62ba1fb4d6d199d5ea388eef13e77a
Story: #2003250

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-03 20:56:28.000000000', 'message': "Don't wait for task in submit_task

The exception shifting performed by the Task class is meant to
protect the TaskManager run method from encountering any exceptions
done in the course of running a task.  This is especially important
for subclasses of TaskManager which implement alternate run
strategies.  The exception is shifted so that it is raised by the
Task.wait method.  In a multi-thread environment, it is the caller
of the submit_task method which should receive the exception, and
therefore it is submit_task which should call Task.wait.  Currently
it is the _run_task method which calls Task.wait, which means the
TaskManager itself receives the exception.

Change-Id: I3a6e61601164811fdd255ae54470011768c99a7d

commit_message:
Don't wait for task in submit_task

The exception shifting performed by the Task class is meant to
protect the TaskManager run method from encountering any exceptions
done in the course of running a task.  This is especially important
for subclasses of TaskManager which implement alternate run
strategies.  The exception is shifted so that it is raised by the
Task.wait method.  In a multi-thread environment, it is the caller
of the submit_task method which should receive the exception, and
therefore it is submit_task which should call Task.wait.  Currently
it is the _run_task method which calls Task.wait, which means the
TaskManager itself receives the exception.

Change-Id: I3a6e61601164811fdd255ae54470011768c99a7d

[{'account_id': 11085, 'date': '2018-05-29 16:38:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2018-05-30 06:49:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11085, 'date': '2018-05-31 13:18:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11085, 'date': '2018-05-31 13:30:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8532, 'date': '2018-06-01 20:50:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

couple small nits, otherwise looks good to me'}, {'account_id': 11085, 'date': '2018-06-04 13:18:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8532, 'date': '2018-06-04 17:44:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-06-05 17:40:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Why cannot this go to the docs? People read release notes once, if ever..'}, {'account_id': 11085, 'date': '2018-06-06 16:05:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-06-06 16:49:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I feel like this could be a lot simpler.  The important bit is kind of buried in a lot of details that users don't really need to know.  I would prefer to give a TLDR version in the release note and refer them to the bug if they want all the details of what goes wrong if you do this.

The important thing for the release note is to point out that you must use the "openstack overcloud delete" command when deleting a TripleO stack instead of "heat stack-delete" or "openstack stack delete".  The current version is particularly confusing since it doesn't even mention "openstack stack delete" which is what users are supposed to be using with Heat right now.'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-06-08 08:56:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

> Why cannot this go to the docs? People read release notes once, if
 > ever..

+1, I think this would make more sense in the docs. This doesn't relate to a recent change, so a release note doesn't make sense to me."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-06-08 15:45:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> > Why cannot this go to the docs? People read release notes once,
 > if
 > > ever..
 > 
 > +1, I think this would make more sense in the docs. This doesn't
 > relate to a recent change, so a release note doesn't make sense to
 > me.

I actually think it's valid in both places, unless it was release noted previously.  This is a pretty significant change in behavior from past versions of TripleO that needs to be explicitly called out in the release notes.  Documenting it in the regular docs is also important since this is not the normal workflow for Heat stacks."}, {'account_id': 11085, 'date': '2018-07-23 18:29:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-07-24 15:40:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

It appears nothing was changed since my previous review.'}, {'account_id': 11085, 'date': '2018-08-06 15:30:15.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

closing this to move the content into the documentation instead of release notes.

https://review.openstack.org/589192'}]

commit_message:
Notes warning for mixing multiple command line clients.

This note is a warning against using project native command line clients
and unified command line client together within a specific operator
workflow.

Change-Id: I8c0120d467775b5eb09b7ea43ae7949f83cd5641
Closes-Bug: 1783180

commit_message:
Move ironic-tempest job for Neutron to "in tree"

Job ironic-tempest-dsvm-ipa-wholedisk-bios-agent_ipmitool-tinyipa
was moved to be defined in Neutron's zuul.yml config file in [1].
There is no need to have it configured in this repo.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/588229/

Change-Id: I7461c1d3080f52e456a51c3df517e15475225838

commit_message:
Set connect_timeout in mysql

This sets the connect_timeout in mysqld, to work around issues with Heat
losing connection to MySQL in the undercloud under load.

Closes-Bug: #1783995
Change-Id: Ia3799cdaf171892431151e4f2f7d2095081b8242

[{'created': '2018-08-06 11:53:17.000000000', 'message': 'vars: Add missing python-keystonemiddleware dependency

The python-keystonemiddleware is needed by swift-proxy-server otherwise
the systemd service fails to start with the following error:

[...]
File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/paste/deploy/loadwsgi.py", line 517, in _context_from_explicit
  swift-proxy-server[11639]:     value = import_string(found_expr)
File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/paste/deploy/loadwsgi.py", line 22, in import_string
  swift-proxy-server[11639]:     return pkg_resources.EntryPoint.parse("x=" + s).load(False)
File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 2321, in load

File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 2327, in resolve

ImportError: No module named keystonemiddleware.auth_token

'}]
commit_message:
vars: Add missing python-keystonemiddleware dependency

The python-keystonemiddleware is needed by swift-proxy-server otherwise
the systemd service fails to start with the following error:

[...]
File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/paste/deploy/loadwsgi.py", line 517, in _context_from_explicit
  swift-proxy-server[11639]:     value = import_string(found_expr)
File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/paste/deploy/loadwsgi.py", line 22, in import_string
  swift-proxy-server[11639]:     return pkg_resources.EntryPoint.parse("x=" + s).load(False)
File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 2321, in load
  return self.resolve()
File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 2327, in resolve
  module = __import__(self.module_name, fromlist=['__name__'], level=0)
ImportError: No module named keystonemiddleware.auth_token

Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages
Change-Id: I2aaddc0c6b3bb5c28eb7f9b45e8d989f2824724d

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I4d8f69f03a1344aaca61b5b45ef3ec0a08eb19fb
Story: #2003250

[{'created': '2018-08-02 09:54:00.000000000', 'message': "Allow tags to be used for MQ tasks

The use of 'include_tasks' and a loop of variables creates
a situation where a user is unable to use tags to scope the
inclusion of only the MQ tasks when running the playbooks.

The use-case this is important for is when the rabbitmq
containers are destroyed and rebuilt in order to resolve
an issue with them, and the user wishes to quickly recreate
all the vhosts/users.

Ansible's 'include_tasks' is a dynamic inclusion, and dynamic
inclusions are not included when using tags. The nice thing
about dynamic inclusions is that they completely skip all
tasks when the condition does not apply, cutting down deploy
time. However, given the use-case, we should rather take on
the extra deployment time.

This patch changes the dynamic inclusion to a static one,
adds a 'common-mq' tag to cover all MQ implementations,
and re-implements the 'common-rabbitmq' tag for the tasks
that relate to RabbitMQ specifically.

It also implements conditionals for each task set so that
the rpc/notify tasks can be skipped if a vhost/user is not
required for that purpose (eg: swift does not use RPC, and
most roles will not use notifications by default).

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/588191
Change-Id: I994ccc0d20e4ec72955e625119a35856a7171ba3

commit_message:
Allow tags to be used for MQ tasks

The use of 'include_tasks' and a loop of variables creates
a situation where a user is unable to use tags to scope the
inclusion of only the MQ tasks when running the playbooks.

The use-case this is important for is when the rabbitmq
containers are destroyed and rebuilt in order to resolve
an issue with them, and the user wishes to quickly recreate
all the vhosts/users.

Ansible's 'include_tasks' is a dynamic inclusion, and dynamic
inclusions are not included when using tags. The nice thing
about dynamic inclusions is that they completely skip all
tasks when the condition does not apply, cutting down deploy
time. However, given the use-case, we should rather take on
the extra deployment time.

This patch changes the dynamic inclusion to a static one,
adds a 'common-mq' tag to cover all MQ implementations,
and re-implements the 'common-rabbitmq' tag for the tasks
that relate to RabbitMQ specifically.

It also implements conditionals for each task set so that
the rpc/notify tasks can be skipped if a vhost/user is not
required for that purpose (eg: swift does not use RPC, and
most roles will not use notifications by default).

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/588191
Change-Id: I994ccc0d20e4ec72955e625119a35856a7171ba3

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-31 15:40:57.000000000', 'message': "Allow mod_wsgi to find application

The refactoring of the wsgi.py file to support uWSGI in devstack
unfortunately broke existing WSGI deployments which fail to load
the Monasca API with a message like this:

Target WSGI script '/monasca-api/monasca_api/api/wsgi.py' does not
contain WSGI application 'application'.

This change allows mod_wsgi to find the application definition.

Change-Id: I9002bdcb4e132495ec639ad3636bdabdd8714e01
Story: 2001919
Task: 23343
"}]
commit_message:
Allow mod_wsgi to find application

The refactoring of the wsgi.py file to support uWSGI in devstack
unfortunately broke existing WSGI deployments which fail to load
the Monasca API with a message like this:

Target WSGI script '/monasca-api/monasca_api/api/wsgi.py' does not
contain WSGI application 'application'.

This change allows mod_wsgi to find the application definition.

Change-Id: I9002bdcb4e132495ec639ad3636bdabdd8714e01
Story: 2001919
Task: 23343

commit_message:
fix markup for links

Sphinx doesn't seem to understand that a link can have query
parameters, so make the markup more explicit so the link is actually
clickable.

Change-Id: If7dae28514b7f959a0af1cc0a132ee7d48cb8428
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

We have the PTL/lead +1 by email at http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-July/132644.html'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-07-31 08:38:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1

Makes a lot of sense to me. Project teams should really be focused on the (upstream) production of OpenStack components, while Security has both an upstream (good security practices in coding) and downstream (security advisories, good security operational practices) focus. So it fits the SIG structure better.

Keeping it both as a project team and a SIG was just confusing.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-07-31 16:13:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-08-06 14:06:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Remove Security project team

Remove the defunct Security project team and reassign all its
remaining Git repositories to the Security SIG which was created May
29, 2018 in change Id51c8dbe9a3cc790d90b30dcf13cbac72fb0b730.

Change-Id: Id5db19efc66abc1f92b7226f344e4030e84158e0

This change has enough votes and can be approved on 2018-08-05.'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2018-08-03 11:43:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-08-03 14:29:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

(13 comments)

I've noted a dozen entries in the I18n team extra-ATCs list which don't seem to have an active OpenStack Foundation Individual Membership or haven't added the listed E-mail address to their member profile if they are a member. This is fine, but they should know that they'll be filtered out of the electoral rolls for PTL and TC elections and therefore unable to vote unless they correct the situation.

For future reference, you can find out whether an address corresponds to a foundation member by anonymously querying https://openstackid-resources.openstack.org/api/public/v1/members?&filter[]=group_slug==foundation-members&filter[]=email==$address (replace $address with the E-mail address in question)."}, {'account_id': 12015, 'date': '2018-08-03 17:39:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-08-03 18:11:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-08-03 20:26:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

 > don't seem to have an active OpenStack Foundation Individual
 > Membership or haven't added the listed E-mail address to their
 > member profile if they are a member. This is fine, but they should
 > know that they'll be filtered out of the electoral rolls for PTL
 > and TC elections and therefore unable to vote unless they correct
 > the situation.
 > 
 > For future reference, you can find out whether an address
 > corresponds to a foundation member by anonymously querying
 > https://openstackid-resources.openstack.org/api/public/v1/members?&filter[]=group_slug==foundation-members&filter[]=email==$address
 > (replace $address with the E-mail address in question).

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/i18n/tree/playbooks/generate_atc.yml#n74

my query to validate membership is similar, but as already mentioned: if the user registered Zanata account with different e-mail address as Openstack account it will never found valid data. I would send out an e-mail to ask the user to configure the Zanata registration e-mail address in OpenStack account. I've tested this and it works."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-08-06 14:05:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
I18n Extra-ATCs for Rocky

List of active translators from 2018-01-11 to 2018-07-09
identified by Zanata Stats API.
Full stats under http://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/I18nTeam/ATC_statistics#Rocky_cycle_.282018-01-11_to_2018-07-09.29

Alex Eng and Patrick Huang are valuable supporter for Zanata
and still on our Extra-ATC list.

Change-Id: I6ee23dd739b8952aa8d054faf8de26150f73f03f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-02 09:40:54.000000000', 'message': "Allow tags to be used for MQ tasks

The use of 'include_tasks' and a loop of variables creates
a situation where a user is unable to use tags to scope the
inclusion of only the MQ tasks when running the playbooks.

The use-case this is important for is when the rabbitmq
containers are destroyed and rebuilt in order to resolve
an issue with them, and the user wishes to quickly recreate
all the vhosts/users.

Ansible's 'include_tasks' is a dynamic inclusion, and dynamic
inclusions are not included when using tags. The nice thing
about dynamic inclusions is that they completely skip all
tasks when the condition does not apply, cutting down deploy
time. However, given the use-case, we should rather take on
the extra deployment time.

This patch changes the dynamc inclusion to a static one,
adds a 'common-mq' tag to cover all MQ implementations,
and re-implements the 'common-rabbitmq' tag for the tasks
that relate to RabbitMQ specifically.

Change-Id: Ifadff940ae1f360f2f663a4fc82b39078937c086

commit_message:
Allow tags to be used for MQ tasks

The use of 'include_tasks' and a loop of variables creates
a situation where a user is unable to use tags to scope the
inclusion of only the MQ tasks when running the playbooks.

The use-case this is important for is when the rabbitmq
containers are destroyed and rebuilt in order to resolve
an issue with them, and the user wishes to quickly recreate
all the vhosts/users.

Ansible's 'include_tasks' is a dynamic inclusion, and dynamic
inclusions are not included when using tags. The nice thing
about dynamic inclusions is that they completely skip all
tasks when the condition does not apply, cutting down deploy
time. However, given the use-case, we should rather take on
the extra deployment time.

This patch changes the dynamic inclusion to a static one,
adds a 'common-mq' tag to cover all MQ implementations,
and re-implements the 'common-rabbitmq' tag for the tasks
that relate to RabbitMQ specifically.

It also implements conditionals for each task set so that
the rpc/notify tasks can be skipped if a vhost/user is not
required for that purpose (eg: swift does not use RPC, and
most roles will not use notifications by default).

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/588191
Change-Id: Ifadff940ae1f360f2f663a4fc82b39078937c086

commit_message:
INFINIDAT: add host.created_by metadata key

This patch adds the "host.created_by" metadata key. The metadata value
indicates the name and version of the INFINIDAT tool which created the
relevant system object.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I0dfa32034c6b138ce8c757f196c27f90475be040

subject: Fix Bootstrap AIO Passing Multiple BOOTSTRAP_OPTS
messages: [{'account_id': 4268, 'date': '2018-08-03 23:25:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 15993, 'date': '2018-08-04 02:11:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-08-05 16:16:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nSomehow same thing than https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566300/ ;-)'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-08-06 11:58:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-03 23:25:04.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Bootstrap AIO Passing Multiple BOOTSTRAP_OPTS

Change #550473 removed the quotes around ${BOOTSTRAP_OPTS}
when running the bootstrap-aio.yml playbook. This broke the
ability to specify multiple BOOTSTRAP_OPTS using the space
separated key=value syntax, as demonstrated in the AIO
Quickstart Guide.

This change fixes the brokenness of BOOTSTRAP_OPTS by pre-
fixing each BOOTSTRAP_OPTS item with a "-e", which will
accomodate specifying multiple vars files, as well as
specifying a mix of "key=value" and "@file.yml" items
in BOOTSTRAP_OPTS.

Change-Id: Ia32c646a180f3d3f868dc73eb38778853fbdf000
Depends-On: Ie3960e2e2ac9c0aff0bc36f46182be2fc0a038b3
Bug: 1784491
(cherry picked from commit 98d774072b5b01bfa39cbbfd8a10ebac9dcdb597)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Bootstrap AIO Passing Multiple BOOTSTRAP_OPTS

Change #550473 removed the quotes around ${BOOTSTRAP_OPTS}
when running the bootstrap-aio.yml playbook. This broke the
ability to specify multiple BOOTSTRAP_OPTS using the space
separated key=value syntax, as demonstrated in the AIO
Quickstart Guide.

This change fixes the brokenness of BOOTSTRAP_OPTS by pre-
fixing each BOOTSTRAP_OPTS item with a "-e", which will
accomodate specifying multiple vars files, as well as
specifying a mix of "key=value" and "@file.yml" items
in BOOTSTRAP_OPTS.

Change-Id: Ia32c646a180f3d3f868dc73eb38778853fbdf000
Depends-On: Ie3960e2e2ac9c0aff0bc36f46182be2fc0a038b3
Bug: 1784491
(cherry picked from commit 98d774072b5b01bfa39cbbfd8a10ebac9dcdb597)

The tempest-multinode-full job is running the c-bak
service on the subnode where swift isn't running, and
because of the "is_enabled_service swift" check, cinder
on the subnode wasn't getting configured to talk to
swift so the c-bak service was down. Since chances are
good that we're running swift, just configure cinder
to always use it.

Change-Id: I86b090967dadeeefc017ff0311beeea9441b6ba6
Closes-Bug: #1783128
'}]
commit_message:
cinder: configure backup_swift_url in subnodes

The tempest-multinode-full job is running the c-bak
service on the subnode where swift isn't running, and
because of the "is_enabled_service swift" check, cinder
on the subnode wasn't getting configured to talk to
swift so the c-bak service was down. Since chances are
good that we're running swift, just configure cinder
to always use it.

Change-Id: I86b090967dadeeefc017ff0311beeea9441b6ba6
Closes-Bug: #1783128

commit_message:
tasks: providers: Rename 'ovs' configuration file

The tasks/main.yml is looking for "{{ neutron_plugin_type.split('.')[-1]
}}_config.yml" file. So if neutron_plugin_type is ml2.ovs, the filename
should be ovs_config.yml. This fixes the problem.

Change-Id: Ia239360dc88be48e06faf18ec7af852a91f427c7

commit_message:
Switch to using stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is maintained
project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch it then.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Also fix the lower-requiremenst.txt to pass the gate.

Change-Id: I498282defd87c4ea16979b729600a179cdd3d01f
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <zulcss@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Allow nested action value formatting

Modify introspection rules to allow formatting to be applied to strings
nested in dicts and lists in the actions.

Change-Id: Ia53e0de98438f7789e9b9136dcd85c1b1274b713
Story: #1670768
Task: #11362

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I6f59056abec4ee0021d705bd74b907029b4e8664

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-19 12:12:04.000000000', 'message': "Gate CentOS 7 and Ubuntu Bionic

There is an increasing demand for CentOS 7 and Ubuntu Bionic
based deployments. We should gate them to make sure we don't overlook
possible hidden issues when running on such distros.

This patch also removes jobs octavia-v1-dsvm-scenario-multinode and
octavia-v1-dsvm-py3x-scenario-multinode from gate list as they are
non-voting. They will continue running as non-voting check jobs.

Change-Id: I55c64557710c2c5749c5916f0ae628d87db1b866
"}, {'created': '2018-07-19 16:15:20.000000000', 'message': "Gate CentOS 7

There is an increasing demand for CentOS 7 based deployments. We should
gate it to make sure we don't overlook possible hidden issues.

This patch also removes jobs octavia-v1-dsvm-scenario-multinode and
octavia-v1-dsvm-py3x-scenario-multinode from gate list as they are
non-voting. They will continue running as non-voting check jobs.

Change-Id: I55c64557710c2c5749c5916f0ae628d87db1b866
"}]
commit_message:
Gate CentOS 7

There is an increasing demand for CentOS 7 based deployments. We should
gate it to make sure we don't overlook possible hidden issues.

This patch also removes jobs octavia-v1-dsvm-scenario-multinode and
octavia-v1-dsvm-py3x-scenario-multinode from gate list as they are
non-voting. They will continue running as non-voting check jobs.

Change-Id: I55c64557710c2c5749c5916f0ae628d87db1b866

commit_message:
Add extended properties support for mongo cluster.

User can specify the number and volume of mongos/configserver with
extended_properties argument when creating mongodb. Currently,
the supported parameters are, num_configsvr, num_mongos,
configsvr_volume_size, configsvr_volume_type, mongos_volume_size
and mongos_volume_type.

Change-Id: I35406f9967ce00a51b320eda37572e96228b209d
Signed-off-by: zhanggang <zhanggang@cmss.chinamobile.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-03 23:24:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Bootstrap AIO Passing Multiple BOOTSTRAP_OPTS

Change #550473 removed the quotes around ${BOOTSTRAP_OPTS}
when running the bootstrap-aio.yml playbook. This broke the
ability to specify multiple BOOTSTRAP_OPTS using the space
separated key=value syntax, as demonstrated in the AIO
Quickstart Guide.

This change fixes the brokenness of BOOTSTRAP_OPTS by pre-
fixing each BOOTSTRAP_OPTS item with a "-e", which will
accomodate specifying multiple vars files, as well as
specifying a mix of "key=value" and "@file.yml" items
in BOOTSTRAP_OPTS.

Change-Id: Ia32c646a180f3d3f868dc73eb38778853fbdf000
Depends-On: Ie3960e2e2ac9c0aff0bc36f46182be2fc0a038b3
Bug: 1784491
(cherry picked from commit 98d774072b5b01bfa39cbbfd8a10ebac9dcdb597)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Bootstrap AIO Passing Multiple BOOTSTRAP_OPTS

Change #550473 removed the quotes around ${BOOTSTRAP_OPTS}
when running the bootstrap-aio.yml playbook. This broke the
ability to specify multiple BOOTSTRAP_OPTS using the space
separated key=value syntax, as demonstrated in the AIO
Quickstart Guide.

This change fixes the brokenness of BOOTSTRAP_OPTS by pre-
fixing each BOOTSTRAP_OPTS item with a "-e", which will
accomodate specifying multiple vars files, as well as
specifying a mix of "key=value" and "@file.yml" items
in BOOTSTRAP_OPTS.

Change-Id: Ia32c646a180f3d3f868dc73eb38778853fbdf000
Depends-On: Ie3960e2e2ac9c0aff0bc36f46182be2fc0a038b3
Bug: 1784491
(cherry picked from commit 98d774072b5b01bfa39cbbfd8a10ebac9dcdb597)

commit_message:
Add support for configuring ppc64le nodes

The aim of this change to the enable puppet-ironic as used by tripleo to
configure ironic and the tftp services in a way that "just works" with
tripleo.

It adds the ability to tweak ironic's command retry and spacing values
as well as creating architecture specific config and bootfile mappings

Blueprint: multiarch-support
Change-Id: Ia64dd21b55474d402315ba7c05e28604fff3aea8
(cherry picked from commit 75477a9754ffeb4580624b6c5d8edb00ef9b033e)

If the keystone user source is immutable, such as an LDAP active directory
implementation, tempest tests that try to create or delete a user will fail.
Instead of failing, we would like them to skip. This change uses a
testtools decorator to avoid unnecessary modifications and allow those tests
to skip.

Change-Id: I94b80529b7fe4aa0b8ca87b0b810a20c6d92160b
Partial-Bug: 1777047
'}]
commit_message:
Support immutable user source in test_users_negative

If the keystone user source is immutable, such as an LDAP active directory
implementation, tempest tests that try to create or delete a user will fail.
Instead of failing, we would like them to skip. This change uses a
testtools decorator to avoid unnecessary modifications and allow those tests
to skip.

Depends-On: Idc09d6272386f026a899787c2151745916a7228d
Change-Id: I94b80529b7fe4aa0b8ca87b0b810a20c6d92160b
Partial-Bug: 1777047

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-09 02:41:42.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia908e642ad1a3f67710d48a71d097c13b7743a5a
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia908e642ad1a3f67710d48a71d097c13b7743a5a

commit_message:
Skip all non-kolla based images in containers-prepare-parameter.yaml

We're introducing a filter based on container image labels for the
tripleo-modify-image role that lets us skip non-kolla based images.
The remaining images are all good potential candidates for the update.

There is no need to maintain a list of excluded images anymore or to
push to the local registry in two separate steps.

Depends-On: Ie7f628bb54c83c78e810320c739afff158234804
Change-Id: Icad8918a7359a863b746b0bf9c2f2597a5c71bf8

commit_message:
Switch to use stestr for unit test

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
So we should switch to stestr.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Ib6985475a257570c2df000dfcabb8600afc11f4f

commit_message:
Add Upgrade impact section to the spec template

It happens that we overlook the upgrade impact of some new
features. Add Upgrade impact section to the spec template to make us
think about how do we upgrade to some feature when proposing that
feature.

Change-Id: I137a4353ce73ae961e83ecd656df77d6bd45a4e4

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I5d9417b189c58a53118f36768870236a92467513
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ib4038138b33c8e85b9038f5f59152222f3b524fe
'}]
commit_message:
Add comments about how to adapt services for FFU

It can be confusing to adapt the changes on resource_registry
for sevices between puppet and docker, add comments on how to
do it properly. Also add missing change about VhostuserSocketGroup
change.

Change-Id: Ib4038138b33c8e85b9038f5f59152222f3b524fe

commit_message:
Use ansible module instead of command

This uses the os_client_config module to make sure the openstack
cloud configuration is well setup on the appropriate nodes.

commit_message:
Add more systematic healthchecks

This reorders the healthchecks to be in-line with the playbook
order of the setup-hosts and setup-infrastructure playbooks.

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ie12e9dc402f6267da41e8ec82846393a81819d78

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ibc0f8b9e6237f91faf47b975b6c74517ffe05264
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

@Nguyen Phuong An: I checked tempest-full logs for failed test. Maybe it is some kind of race condition between neutron-api and neutron-rpc processes now? Port from this failed vm wasn't transition to ACTIVE because L2 agent said that it's not bound: http://logs.openstack.org/18/473718/13/check/tempest-full/02977a6/controller/logs/screen-q-agt.txt.gz?level=WARNING#_May_07_07_46_47_147648 but from what is in neutron-api logs it should be bound: http://logs.openstack.org/18/473718/13/check/tempest-full/02977a6/controller/logs/screen-neutron-api.txt.gz#_May_07_07_46_44_650816"}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2018-05-15 09:45:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2018-05-26 17:15:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review-1

Hi. In Debian, I've split neutron-server to neutron-api and neutron-rpc-server packages and services. Please use neutron-rpc-server as service name, to keep consistency with Debian. I've also told other distros (ie: Ubuntu and Fedora) to use "neutron-rpc-server" as service name. That's also what Neutron uses for the thing is /usr/bin, so it makes sense to use that.

Also, I would suggest that you have a look to the Debian package to see what I've done for the startup, so that it loads with the correct --config-file= parameters using the --pyargv option of uwsgi. The way I did is IMO versatile enough to handle most cases. I don't need the OS_NEUTRON_CONFIG_DIR thing from Phuong An, and in fact, part of the patch breaks my setup (see my comments over there).

Last, I'd love to have the bound race condition thing fixed. Does anyone has more details about it?'}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2018-05-29 03:13:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

Hi Thomas,

Thank you for your great review. I've just return home after long flight from the summit. I'm sorry for delay you a bit. I'll figure out the issue related to racing condition and let you ASAP. when the Neutron API is loaded via a WSGI entry point to
serve the agents.

commit_message:
WSGI Neutron integration

This patch provides a new mechanism to deploy Neutron using
WSGI script. This also starts a Neutron RPC server process
when the Neutron API is loaded via a WSGI entry point to
serve the agents.

Co-Authored-By: Victor Morales <victor.morales@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Nguyen Phuong An <AnNP@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: I16a199b04858bfc03ef50d9883154dba8b0d66ea
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580049/
Partially-implements: blueprint run-in-wsgi-server

Some services running as vhost, as nova_placement make

then the check will start failing again.

[0] - https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-common/blob/master/healthcheck/nova-placement#L6

Change-Id: I5a325be424740e80eafd6b4abd8eb4b3111740aa
Closes-Bug: #1781623
(cherry picked from commit f1a1c324fb149d40c960f1eaba650f0e8c71d91e)
'}]
commit_message:
Take WSGIScriptAlias into account in docker healthcheck.

Some services running as vhost, as nova_placement make
use of an  alias in which the wsgi service is mapped.
Currently, the nova_placement healthcheck has hardcoded
the alias in the curl [0] request, but if this alias
changes or other service modifies its from / to another,
then the check will start failing again.

[0] - https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-common/blob/master/healthcheck/nova-placement#L6

Change-Id: I5a325be424740e80eafd6b4abd8eb4b3111740aa
Closes-Bug: #1781623
(cherry picked from commit f1a1c324fb149d40c960f1eaba650f0e8c71d91e)

commit_message:
Flatten tests directory

Looking at the structuring of API and scenario tests among Tempest
plugins, almost none of them places tests for different APIs into
individual directories such as: flavors, limits etc.. In particular, such
convention does not occur in the Tempest repository, on which plugins
should be modeled. In order to comply with Tempest standards and improve
exploreability, this change flattens tests directory.

Change-Id: I579a37aa736e2cfa677c0b38fcf89afb67413d7d
Signed-off-by: Bartosz Zurkowski <b.zurkowski@samsung.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-05 21:33:58.000000000', 'message': "Modify instance naming schema

When creating a new instance, generate its name based on
tenant name, application name and a region, therefore not using
a complicated composite structure used in Murano (murano+hashed),
and just UI generated name is displayed.

Also, the new schema takes into account names of the already
created instances to avoid duplication. For now, the 'hostname'
field for applications are still readonly, that would be changed
as validation is implemented.

Signed-off-by: Roman Bogorodskiy <rbogorodskiy@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I7bd0758cf4b04a01531c788ebedc06a5c98fe523
Signed-off-by: Leonid Bogdanov <lbogdanov@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Modify instance naming schema

When creating a new instance, generate its name based on
tenant name, application name and a region, therefore not using
a complicated composite structure used in Murano (murano+hashed),
and just UI generated name is displayed.

Also, the new schema takes into account names of the already
created instances to avoid duplication. For now, the 'hostname'
field for applications are still readonly, that would be changed
as validation is implemented.

Co-Authored-By: Artem Tiumentcev <darland.maik@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Roman Bogorodskiy <rbogorodskiy@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I7bd0758cf4b04a01531c788ebedc06a5c98fe523
Signed-off-by: Leonid Bogdanov <lbogdanov@mirantis.com>

Bionic requires a functioning gpg-agent to run apt-key add. This means
that gpg-agent must be working properly in the chroot when the lxc image
preparation script runs.

Previous changes [1] have enabled apt-key to communicate with gpg-agent

every time when lxc_hosts is used within other role checks.

This is not a new issue, debian-installer is affected too [2].

This change adopts the same route as d-i, and simply copies the host
/etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d directory to the LXC image, removing the
need for apt-key and in turn gpg-agent.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/588629/
[2] https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=851774

Change-Id: Ia511881f675cd88ecc58360b18531f0dac486b70
'}]
commit_message:
Simplify inserting apt keys into LXC image

Bionic requires a functioning gpg-agent to run apt-key add. This means
that gpg-agent must be working properly in the chroot when the lxc image
preparation script runs.

Previous changes [1] have enabled apt-key to communicate with gpg-agent
during the lxc_hosts role checks, however the cache prep fails almost
every time when lxc_hosts is used within other role checks.

This is not a new issue, debian-installer is affected too [2].

This change adopts the same route as d-i, and simply copies the host
/etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d directory to the LXC image, removing the
need for apt-key and in turn gpg-agent.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/588629/
[2] https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=851774

Change-Id: Ia511881f675cd88ecc58360b18531f0dac486b70

commit_message:
Sets correct permission for /etc/hosts

presently while genearting the hosts file and
replacing the original one , the file permission is
replaced  with no access for world and ownership
changes from root to centos.

Secondary nodes, in the cluster while trying to
resolve primary host address can't  read the host
name and ip from hosts file and fails to connect.

This fix restores the hosts file permission correctly

Change-Id: Ia9b7e609644c93d13108af88aa3dacf94fc19ceb
Task: #23261
Story: #2003139
(cherry picked from commit fee5d179880c50de62bcd8bb32c833d8cdc9c419)

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I1c4aaa0e0909f5272ab970950e3d21662dee2227

[{'created': '2017-01-05 20:41:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Statistics offset tests for Vertica

There were a couple of bugs in the Vertica code:
1. All of the measurements from the previous bucket need to be
   excluded when an offset is used
2. Determining which offset type to was incorrect because the
   else if expression was not different from the if expression

Also, the tests were trying parse the offsets which should be
opaque. Changed to just select the right parts of the statistics
from all possible. Was slightly complex because one of the test
used two statistics

commit_message:
Fix Statistics offset tests for Vertica

There were a couple of bugs in the Vertica code:
1. All of the measurements from the previous bucket need to be
   excluded when an offset is used
2. Determining which offset type to was incorrect because the
   else if expression was not different from the if expression

Also, the tests were trying parse the offsets which should be
opaque. Changed to just select the right parts of the statistics
from all possible. Was slightly complex because one of the test
used two statistics

commit_message:
Drop obsolete `overcloud ceph-upgrade run`

After switching from Heat workflow resources to external_deploy_tasks,
the `ceph-upgrade run` command no longer works and can be
dropped. Instead we'll be using `external-update run` and
`external-upgrade run` commands.

Partial-Bug: #1783949
Change-Id: I228ce6228d0bd0bd4d40bc7a7cdd6bfe98a7a6ed

commit_message:
Update/upgrade commands for services with external installers

New `openstack overcloud external-update run` and `openstack overcloud
external-upgrade run` commands are defined. These are meant to perform
updates and upgrades for services deployed via
external_deploy_tasks. A separate command is used because external
installers don't fit well within the --nodes and --roles selection
pattern we've established for the normal `update run` and `upgrade
run` commands.

Partial-Bug: #1783949
Depends-On: Ib2474e8f69711cd6610a78884d5032ffd19ad249
Depends-On: I982032a0eadfbfb7f1eadee9cae26c8cd5fcdbba
Change-Id: Ib2f32ae8ac234b0c25b0e1ff1f8f8d8e041185e0

when run devstack of monasca-api, monasca-analytics install
scala ,and found download url is
https://downloads.typesafe.com/scala/2.9.2.7/scala-2.9.2.7.deb
the resource is not exist.and version bigger than 2.10.5 can
download from url https://downloads.typesafe.com/scala, version

Closes-Bug:#1666767

Change-Id: I2780542e8436f4b924ac8222467312034be69f37
'}]
commit_message:
fix version err：scala-2.9.2.7 caused by setting in devstack/setting

when run devstack of monasca-api, monasca-analytics install
scala ,and found download url is
https://downloads.typesafe.com/scala/2.9.2.7/scala-2.9.2.7.deb
the resource is not exist.and version bigger than 2.10.5 can
download from url https://downloads.typesafe.com/scala, version
below is download from http://www.scala-lang.org/files/archive
Closes-Bug:#1666767

Change-Id: I2780542e8436f4b924ac8222467312034be69f37

subject: Fixes zuul issues
messages: [{'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-08-06 10:48:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-08-06 10:57:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-06 10:48:49.000000000', 'message': "Fixes zuul issues

Some issues were not caught during the initial mock autospec
patch which was added to compute_hyperv, and now they're causing
some unit tests to fail. This patch fixes those issues.

Secondly, the docs job relies on tools/tox_install.sh to install
nova, but it is not passing the required arguments, causing it to
fail. This patch updates the script so it can properly execute.

Change-Id: I91cbadb2a05ee4880c3fa761696818ec95c40df2
(cherry picked from commit 48bb0d6b41b57ab29e8b2db73ede818812ade08e)

tests: uses oslotest as the test base

oslotest's base will add mock.patch.stopall, so we don't have to.

Change-Id: If13a465000648dfbf1e229a3b8d765e8b3204db4
(cherry picked from commit 8dd291019570c1a2b4f5b61cbebb50f166accf49)
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes zuul issues

Some issues were not caught during the initial mock autospec
patch which was added to compute_hyperv, and now they're causing
some unit tests to fail. This patch fixes those issues.

Secondly, the docs job relies on tools/tox_install.sh to install
nova, but it is not passing the required arguments, causing it to
fail. This patch updates the script so it can properly execute.

Change-Id: I91cbadb2a05ee4880c3fa761696818ec95c40df2
(cherry picked from commit 48bb0d6b41b57ab29e8b2db73ede818812ade08e)

tests: uses oslotest as the test base

oslotest's base will add mock.patch.stopall, so we don't have to.

Change-Id: If13a465000648dfbf1e229a3b8d765e8b3204db4
(cherry picked from commit 8dd291019570c1a2b4f5b61cbebb50f166accf49)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-31 08:34:37.000000000', 'message': 'Support health check for Docker containers

The docker has supported healthcheck. It is useful for application
container.
Zun may integration these options.

HEALTHCHECK

  --health-cmd Command to run to check health
  --health-interval Time between running the check
  --health-retries Consecutive failures needed to report unhealthy
  --health-timeout Maximum time to allow one check to run
  In zun, the four parameter are cmd, interval, retries, timeout.

  Partial-Implements: blueprint support-healthycheck

Change-Id: I1f4f6a5536a33ecb9ac9c032b119a9349e3616ee

Zun may integration these options.

commit_message:
Support health check for Docker containers

The docker has supported healthcheck. It is useful for application
container.
Zun may integration these options.

  --health-cmd Command to run to check health
  --health-interval Time between running the check
  --health-retries Consecutive failures needed to report unhealthy
  --health-timeout Maximum time to allow one check to run
  In zun, the four parameter are cmd, interval, retries, timeout.

Partial-Implements: blueprint support-healthycheck

Change-Id: I1f4f6a5536a33ecb9ac9c032b119a9349e3616ee

subject: Fixes zuul issues
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-06 10:10:03.000000000', 'message': "Fixes zuul issues

Some issues were not caught during the initial mock autospec
patch which was added to compute_hyperv, and now they're causing
some unit tests to fail. This patch fixes those issues.

Secondly, the docs job relies on tools/tox_install.sh to install
nova, but it is not passing the required arguments, causing it to
fail. This patch updates the script so it can properly execute.

Change-Id: I91cbadb2a05ee4880c3fa761696818ec95c40df2
(cherry picked from commit 48bb0d6b41b57ab29e8b2db73ede818812ade08e)
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes zuul issues

Some issues were not caught during the initial mock autospec
patch which was added to compute_hyperv, and now they're causing
some unit tests to fail. This patch fixes those issues.

Secondly, the docs job relies on tools/tox_install.sh to install
nova, but it is not passing the required arguments, causing it to
fail. This patch updates the script so it can properly execute.

Change-Id: I91cbadb2a05ee4880c3fa761696818ec95c40df2
(cherry picked from commit 48bb0d6b41b57ab29e8b2db73ede818812ade08e)

commit_message:
Include the stack name when generating the tripleo-ansible-inventory

The stack name is not included when
generating the tripleo-ansible-inventory
this patch adds this option.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-08 14:59:51.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ibb8ce8e655643161b0b7d4e84f0c2897e9c6417c
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ibb8ce8e655643161b0b7d4e84f0c2897e9c6417c

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I90c548df545990a4575628d918f2bce72071c9ca
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Use --os-endpoint-type for Cinder CLI

The --endpoint-type option has been deprecated in Cinder for several
years and was just recently removed. It was missed that the tempest lib
CLI code was still using that to specify the public URL. This updates
the Cinder CLI handling to use the more conventional --os-endpoint-type.

Change-Id: Icb81710a6b905d80c2e75b29be449dc029e01bdd
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
Closes-bug: #1783885

Make providers use auth_url for authentication

When reading credentials from the configuration's keystone_authtoken
section auth_uri was used as URL for Keystone.

the Puppet agent, this change uses the more appropriate auth_url as
Keystone URL.
